results.description: This is a group for women who are interested in learning more about nontoxic beauty, body, and cleaning products. We live in a world where exposure to toxic chemicals can feel difficult to escape (especially in NYC!!) so it is important to make improvements in places where we do have control. We can make smarter choices for our own bodies, our families, and in our homes. Luckily there is a growing number of safe alternatives available, and many are just as effective, if not more so, than their drugstore equivalents. I want to create a community where we can learn from one another and share ideas, hopefully meeting once a month or more. I have a lot of information to share about high performing safe products, as well as things you can create in your own kitchen. I would love to have a space where we can share recipes, ideas, advice, and support and through this create healthier and happier lives for ourselves and others!

results.description: Pecha Kucha ペチャクチャ , or “chit chat” in Japanese, is a concise presentation style, comprised of twenty slides at a duration of twenty seconds each that advance automatically. This format, devised by Klein Dytham Architecture, powers multi-speaker events called Pecha Kucha Nights. PKNs invite creatives of all fields to meet, present projects, and exchange ideas in 750+ cities around the world. Pecha Kucha has a global reputation for an eclectic mix of artists, activists, musicians, comedians, designers, architects, filmmakers, photographers, writers, mountaineers, et al coming together to make their patented Pecha Kucha presentation in front of an attentive, appreciative, and appropriately lubricated audience. For presenters and spectators alike, these are always great evenings.
results.name: Pecha Kucha Night Brooklyn

results.description:
This meetup group is the New York chapter of Medicine X (http://medicinex.stanford.edu). Medicine X is a catalyst for new ideas about the future of medicine and health care. The initiative explores how emerging technologies will advance the practice of medicine, improve health, and empower patients to be active participants in their own care. Such emerging technologies include those that are:

• largely digital (e.g., online peer-to-peer healthcare communities, wearables);

• methodological (e.g., human-centered design and innovation, service design);

• cultural (e.g., participatory medicine, doctors and patients functioning as designers);

• and more.

This group is intended to bring together (e)patients, healthcare providers, experience designers, technologists, and researchers. The group will offer opportunities to hear from key members of these communities, experience emerging technologies, collaborate on projects, and more.

Contact the organizer(s) if you want to volunteer to speak at a meeting or recommend speakers. Contact the organizer(s) also if you are interested in providing a venue for meetings or in being a meetup sponsor, or if you would like to recommend possibilities for either.
results.name: Medicine X - New York Area

results.description:
-Are you a pretty self-aware person and yet you and your partner still get swept up in bitter fights that leave you feeling hurt and disconnected? 

-Or maybe one of you gets needy and demanding and the other partner withdraws? 

-Or maybes it seems that your partner doesn’t care about your needs and you’re living like roommates instead of soul mates? 

-Do you feel unappreciated, misunderstood, or rejected? 

Issues like these are normal in long term relationships, and there ARE proven strategies to turn your relationship around, to experience love, intimacy, and passion again! 

In this group we learn how to transform conflict into intimacy with the guidance of Relationship Coach Valerie Greene, and we share mutual support, so we can deepen our love relationships. 

Here, you'll find your community who are going through similar challenges in their relationships, and it's helpful to know that you're not alone, isn't it? I know I could have used a group like this when I chose to transform my relationship.

As of now, for a limited time, membership in this meetup is completely free, and admission to our meetings is free as well, because we want to get this information out to as many people as possible.

results.description:
I decided to create this meetup after years of feeling determined to take charge of my lifestyle and exercise habits and falling flat. One week of energetic enthusiasm would soon turn into making excuses as to why I was too tired or busy to work out. However, one thing I did notice was that if I had an appointment, I always kept it and was never late. I decided to fuse these two characteristics and see if it could help turn things around.

In it together is a meetup for people who want to begin slowly and work their way into a healthier lifestyle and fitness routine. This is not going to be the place where we get together for advanced hot yoga. This is short runs and walks in the reservation or locations close to us (Springfield), group fitness classes, healthy eating/juice meetups and encouraging each other. I am 30 years old and first beginning this journey but I hope anyone feels welcome to join regardless of your current fitness abilities.

I am far from an expert, just looking to change my fitness/health level and I hope you are too! The only rule is that if you RSVP that you'll attend an event or workout please do not cancel on me last minute. We're here to encourage each other and work together so let's start now!

topics.name: Love Yourself and Attract True Love

results.description:
Have you been craving true love, a long term relationship, soulmate love and/or lasting love? Have you noticed patterns in your relationships that you'd like to change? Do you want healthier, happier relationships where a) you treat yourself better and b) your partner treats you better? Do you want to read Calling In The One by Katherine Woodward Thomas?

The point of this meet-up group is to read through the Calling In The One book (CITO for short), do the exercises and check in every week and keep ourselves on track - going through one chapter every week or two, depending on how ambitious we're feeling. The book is 8 chapters including the introduction. We'll meet once a week and discuss what we've read, how the exercises went & what we're learning about ourselves, our progress & our patterns in relationships. This meet-up is open to men & women. About you: you're committed to showing up consistently (missing 1 or 2 weeks at most) & you're someone who finishes what you start.

results.description:
Developing an Attractive Mindset Do you have any social phobia that just doesn't allow your attractive self to come out? I grew up with crazy social phobias which wouldn't allow myself to express my true personality. 

Let's face it, most of us live in our heads and we are slaves to that voice. I was fortunate to live with a life coach in personal development and learnt how to develop natural confidence by learning how to talk to MYSELF better. To become comfortable in social situations, is to develop a strong relationship with your OWN self. 

This meetup is based on: 

• Talks and discussions on social phobia behaviors such as Dealing with and Overcoming rejection Approval Seeking Social Anxiety Overly Self-conscious (especially with the opposite sex) Fear other people will judge Constant comparison to others 

• Action steps and Drills to help kill "social phobia" behavior 

• Exercises you can do at home to strengthen the relationship with yourself.

***Events and talks will be catered to  men or women,  and sometimes both***
results.name: Developing The Attractive Mindset

NLP (Neuro-Linguistic Programming) is a model of excellence, communication and change. Whether you are interested in being more successful in your endeavors, enhance your communication skills or want to feel better in general, there's something for everyone here. There will be a brief intro to NLP, as well as opportunity to ask questions and learn more about NLP. We will also break into groups and work in pairs on specific goals and issues. You can, for example create resourceful states to be a more comfortable speaker or sales person, or feel more comfortable in stressful situations. Whatever daily challenges you face, NLP is a shortcut to finding solutions to create better outcomes. This group is perfect for anyone interested in personal growth and improving their communication skills, as well as entrepreneurs and small business owners looking for creative solutions to business related challenges.

topics.name: Grupo de Crecimiento Personal Para Mujeres

results.description:
Somos un grupo de Mujeres Masones afiliadas al Gran Oriente Femenino de Veracruz, México. Tenemos dos Logias en Miami, FL., una nombrada Respetable Logia Simbólica Femenina "Tiferet" No. 47 y la Respetable Logia Simbólica Femenina "Gueburah" BD en formación. 

Nuestro propósito es crear la simiente de una tercera Logía dirigida por nuestra querida hermana Maestra Masón Judit Vítores.      

El Gran Oriente Femenino de Veracruz recibe su Gran Carta Patente el 16 de septiembre de 1991 por parte de la Gran Logia Femenina de Francia, siendo Veracruz la única Gran Logia Femenina Regular en el Continente Americano en Francia. 

France Sornet, en aquel entonces Gran Maestra de la Gran Logia Femenina de Francia,  vuela a Veracruz elevándose la Categoría de los trabajos en Inter potenciales y constituyéndose la Confederación de Grandes Logias Femeninas Regulares  de los Estados Unidos Mexicanos 

El 21 de marzo de 1999 el Venerable Hermano Humberto Martínez Cruz otorga al Gran Oriente Femenino de Veracruz la Gran Carta Patente que da la regularidad total a toda la Confederación por lo que por acuerdo de todas las Grandes Logias Confederadas, Veracruz pasa a ser la Cuna de la Masonería Femenina Mexicana. 

En el 2005 se constituye el Supremo Consejo de Soberanas Grandes Inspectoras Generales del Grado 33. 

La actual Muy Respetable Gran Maestra es Lilia Santillán de Maza y la Soberana Gran Comendora I:.P:.H:. es Ana Laura Vila Martínez, ingeniera en su vida profana y con una larga trayectoria masónica.

Nuestro Rito es el Rito Escocés Antiguo y Aceptado trabajando en los grados del 1 al 33. 

Pertenecemos a FAMAF (Federación Americana de Masonería Femenina).

Para más información contáctenos o vaya a nuestra página web: http://www.masoneria-femenina-en-miami.com/ 

La coordinadora

results.description:
For those who find the idea of a virgin birth mind-numbing, the concept of "original sin" brain-straining, or an all-powerful and loving, yet jealous and vindictive, deity problematic, we invite you to spend time with similarly thinking folks.

HopeLines, a non-denominational and utterly, non-traditional church, offers an alternative to the traditional religious overhead of blind faith, endless guilt, and questionable rationality. We focus on the wisdom teachings attributed to the ancient sages. With 78% of the American population purporting some measure of Christianity, HopeLines includes, but is not limited to, the discourses ascribed to Jesus.

Our appeal is to those for whom spiritual freedom trumps religious restraints, and the notion of God is not taboo, supernatural, human-like, or humanized.

Through the precepts of ancient sages such as Lao Tzu, Siddhartha Gautama, Ptah-hotep, and Jesus (to name a few), HopeLines' mission is to encourage ways of thinking and living that:

● Build and maintain our birthright of excellent character.

● Embody active compassion as a celebration of life and living.

● Practice innate wisdom as our alignment with the God within and without.

● Unite Mind and Spirit to actualize our awesome potential.

"We believe that our goal is to meld with the powerful, yet subtle, law of our existence:" says Rev. Alexander, facilitator of HopeLines Church, "the law of cause and effect. Some call it God."

ABOUT HopeLines

HopeLines is a non-denominational, non-traditional church. Focused on living clearly, cleanly, and wisely, HopeLines awakens and celebrates the God in us all.  (Read more at our website, http://hopelines.org.)

results.description:
Franglish is an unique and innovative French/English and Spanish/English language exchange event taking place every week from 7 to 9pm in some of the best venues across New York City.

Franglish organises events in more than 10 cities in France and in the UK (and now in the USA) and our community has more than 50 000 members. Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/LanguageExchangeNewYork

Practicing is the best way to learn a language and you'll discover French/Spanish/English culture with locals and foreigners. FREE events (tip supported, give what you want at the end of the event).

Over 30 people attend each event. Your French/Spanish/English doesn't have to be perfect, a lot of people come who speak very little French/Spanish/English.

Discover Franglish and its unique format of 1-to-1 conversations that last for 14 minutes (7 min in English, 7 min in French or Spanish), that gives you the opportunity to meet many native speakers. But Franglish doesn’t just stop there. Ask around – you’ll find that many people find their friends at Franglish.
results.name: French/English and Spanish/English Language Exchange in NYC

results.description:
Each Suppers meeting has its own purpose and personality. There are only three non-negotiable principles common to all meetings: 

1. that we all actively practice non-judgment 

2. that we all prepare meals from single, whole, fresh foods with very limited processed food 

3. that we all avoid commercial messages and the promotion of any particular diet, product or service 

Beyond that, facilitators create meetings based on their own particular passions, be it teaching people to prepare raw vegan meals, to managing or reversing diabetes through lifestyle change, to teaching people how to transition the family taste buds from junk to healthy food. We do this by creating safe and friendly settings where people with food-related health challenges can develop and manage their own personal transition to a healthier lifestyle. We focus on preparing healthy mood-stabilizing meals from whole foods, including easy one-pot meals like soups, stews, chili, salads, and slaws. Forge new friendships and get support based on healthy living.  The program is free to users except for the shared cost of the meal, about $15/meeting. Feel free to visit our main website for additional information and other meetings not posted on MeetUp.com - www.thesuppersprograms.org

Please note that active participation in Suppers Meetups is required to be a continuing member.  The goals of the program cannot be achieved if you cannot attend in person.  Cooking, eating, and meeting together is the underlying foundation of Suppers.  So if you are unable to attend 3 meetings in a 12 month period, you will be removed from the Meetup.  You are free to rejoin when your schedule permits your presence at meetings.
results.name: Vegan Suppers in the Bronx

results.description: Welcome! The NYC Inter-Connected Professionals Networking Group is a diverse mix of respected, ambitious professionals from similar, related or overlapping fields, dedicated to networking, collaborating with each other on events, workshops and seminars, promoting one another's businesses, and sharing resources for successful business growth and development. Some of our concrete goals are: -- Sharing referrals of potential clients, and sharing *sources* of client referrals with one another; -- Sharing and discussing various other networking events that we can each attend, while promoting each other and ourselves at these events; -- Sharing and exchanging valuable resources, such as online advertising mediums, social media marketing, tips on bookkeeping programs, cost-cutting measures, and -- Collaborating on potential workshops or speaking engagements together or individually, which can promote our respective businesses or services.
results.name: The NYC Inter-Connected Professionals Networking Group

results.description:
The Art League of the Chathams (ALC) is a supportive community of visual artists living in the Chatham area of NJ. The League's mission is to nurture the artistic development of its members and to foster an appreciation of their work in the community. League membership is open to visual artists and art enthusiast who live in Chatham Township, Chatham Borough and near-by towns.

The major role of ALC is to exhibit members’ art work at the Chatham Township Municipal Building (at 58 Meyersville Road) and at the Chatham Borough Municipal Building (at 54 Fairmount Ave). ALC members also have opportunities to display their work at other venues in the area. 

Current members of Art League of the Chathams (ALC) can automatically join the group for free as long as their dues are up to date. 

Don't know our group and are you interested in our events? JOIN US on this site and follow the direction how to become ALC member. ALC membership dues are $20 for an individual, $30 for a couple/family annually. Detailed information regarding benefits and how to pay the dues can be found on our website. http://www.artleagueofthechathams.org/id6.h... or on this site under "More" and "Files" ('Benefits' file and 'Join' file). Artist who are not current members and would like to join have 60 days trial period. Once you send in your dues, your profile will state "exempt from dues".  

Important: Please DO NOT pay trough Meetup service. The ALC meetup site is managed by an individual person and the payment would be send to her. The payment NEEDS TO BE SENT to ALC treasurer as described in links/file.  

For more detailed information please visit our website at: www.artleagueofthechathams.org
results.name: Art League of the Chathams     ALC

results.description:
We are a self-organizing group of practitioners, inspired by Frederic Laloux's book "Reinventing Organizations", committed to supporting organizations and leadership to evolve and embody the qualities of "Teal" - Self-Management, Evolutionary Purpose, and Wholeness.

We will be exploring the ideas, principles, and practices from Laloux's book, as well as other related material, through facilitated conversations and exercises. We will often use tools and methods from the Art of Hosting, a collaborative approach to participatory leadership and decision-making. Our members are invited and encouraged to show up with their curiosity and excitement and to find ways to contribute to our budding community.

Through our meetings we hope to provide the soil (community) in which new seeds (ideas) can be planted, fertilized, and nourished, eventually growing to become healthy expressions of creativity (projects) that connect and support each other to give rise to a new eco-system (social structures).

Join us if you are:

• frustrated with the current way that your organization operates in terms of meetings, management, strategy, and execution, and you know there must be a better way;

• passionate about unleashing the potential of business as a force for good and aligning enterprise with purpose;

• sensing that there is a significant shift occurring in our social systems and wondering how it applies to organizations and how you can contribute to the transition;

• looking to connect with like-minded individuals who are also working to make our organizations function in a more healthy, dynamic, and life-affirming way
results.name: Teal Organizations NYC Community of Practice

results.description: Let's get together for Healthy and Wellness in our neighborhood.An opportunity to share testimonials,and results. Its a fun informal space where many professionals attend . Welcome!

results.description:
This is an acoustic instrumental slow jam focusing on tunes in the following traditions: Irish, English, New England Old Time, French Canadian, American Southern, and maybe even Scandinavian. Tunes are those that are typically suitable for contra dancing or other traditional fiddle tunes. This group is intended to provide a musical home for folks interested in playing tunes with other musicians, learning to play by ear and overall increasing their own musical skill. It’s fun and welcoming to all ages (see venue for 21+ restrictions) and levels of playing. 

What do we mean by SLOW JAM? All acoustic instruments (e.g., fiddle, mandolin, guitar, cello, etc.) are welcome and we play songs that typically follow the AABB format (two “A” parts followed by two “B” parts) and we will simply play it over many repeats and if you know it, great (!), but if you don’t, you try to figure it out as we go along, maybe picking up a few notes here and there.  There's no pressure, but it can be a challenge!

All levels? Yes! This jam will be at a speed that is accessible to advanced beginner, but welcome to all levels.

Please click on the "Pages" tab for more a more detailed description.
results.name: Brooklyn Traditional Slow Jam

results.description:
Ski and snowboard carpools. Why? Because buses are great but they're not for everyone. Because driving alone is expensive and not having a ride is a tragedy. Because you want to shred as often as possible. 

We want to help. We're hosting frequent meetups (multiple per month) in NYC and NJ to connect folks that want to carpool to the mountains. Connect and carpool by attending a meetup or by posting to our forums. You can also post to www.shredshare.io to reach folks that are not on meetup but still looking to carpool to the mountains.

We hope to see you on the hill!
results.name: NY/NJ SKI and SNOWBOARD CARPOOLS

topics.name: Singles Who Love to Travel Travel

results.description:
Welcome to the West Hempstead Solo Travel meetup! 

Simply put, this group is created with the solo traveller in mind  If you love to travel, but sometimes find it hard to get someone to tag along then this group is for you. Travelling alone can sometimes be a daunting prospect, particularly in countries where English is not commonly spoken or understood, or in places with a high culture shock factor.   Travelling as part of an organised group in faraway places provides security and peace of mind. 

The group purpose is so members can share their travel experiences with like minded people who have the same passion for travel.



So come join us, and live the travel dream  you’ve always dreamed of.

results.description:
This meet up is for Independent Workers, whether you are doing it full time, or just on the side to earn extra income. If you work for one of the new On-Demand platforms, like Uber, Postmates, Shyp, TaskRabbit, Gigwalk or many others. Join us to discuss the new platforms that are popping up, offering more work opportunities. Your fellow workers will especially be interested in hearing about your experiences with the various platforms. 

Howe are you maintaining work/life balance?  What are the most marketable skills?

Being on your own - how do you handle the complexities of working for yourself  / 1099 or W2 - the pros and cons

We want to meet in order to learn from each other's experiences and maybe tell a few stories about your craziest gigs along the way.

results.description: Pickup Soccer NYC held its first games in Summer 2006 and was the first, organized pickup soccer organization to exist in NYC. PSNYC is a co-ed, recreational soccer group playing organized soccer games in Manhattan and Brooklyn year-round. The group comes together around playing the sport for fun, not competition and we do not keep score at games. Our games are informal and recreational with an emphasis on NON-competitive play. PICKUP SOCCER NYC is an organized, co-ed recreational group that holds open soccer games year-round several days a week at playing fields across Manhattan. All games are held on full-sized grass/turf playing fields with anywhere from 12-30 players per given game. Attendance is optional once you sign up and you can attend as few or as many games as you wish. The group is composed of players of all ages, backgrounds and nationalities. We are not a league nor do we use refs or officials. We moderate games ourselves making our own calls. We do not keep score. The group is open to all skill levels and our membership encompasses a mix of playing experience and abilities - from beginner to former pro.
results.name: PSNYC / Pickup Soccer NYC Soccer - Meetup Group

results.description:
Want to lose weight with a structured program that is SIMPLE to follow? It results in fast, safe, and predictable weight loss! Let's experience the journey TOGETHER! I am a Registered Dietitian-Nutritionist and Certified Health Coach- I have THE solution for you and will provide support every step of the way!! We will meet/talk on a regular basis to keep us all moving in the right direction and to celebrate our successes in a supportive and empathetic environment.  In our meetings, we will focus on the many Habits of Health to get you where you want to go!

Who should join?  If you are looking to lose weight, get healthier, increase your energy, reduce medications, reduce stress and have support from a coach and group while doing it, this group is for you!

Why?  Nothing promotes long-term success like a supportive environment where you can share your successes and challenges without being judged.  This model and program work amazingly for that reason. 

Purpose: To bring people together who have a shared mission of getting healthy and losing weight, and learning together and from each other!
results.name: Weight Loss & Transformation Meetup

results.description:
This is a group for any adults, professionals, and graduate students who want to learn more about Adult ADD and ADHD. Getting information, advice, and support from others coping with the challenges of Adult ADD is a powerful way to start overcoming your own challenges with time management, project planning, organization, and procrastination. We know because we have been there. 

This education forum is intended to bring together adults and professionals so they don't have to deal with ADD alone and can find others who understand and identify rather than judge and lecture. The group is run by two clinical psychologists with over 20 years of experience helping adults and professionals in the NYC area thrive at work and home despite their ADD symptoms. We have also struggled with our own ADD symptoms and learned ways to compensate through the support and help of others.  Join us for an informative, empowering experience at the Center for Optimal Performance conveniently located by all major transit hubs in Midtown Manhattan.
results.name: Adults and Professionals with ADD or ADHD

results.description:
Hello friends,
My meetup events are centered on teaching you whole body wellness by adopting mindset, intention and essential oils into your everyday life to experience joy, accomplishment and purpose. 
I incorporate essential oils to assist our mind in uncovering our deepest blocks preventing us from creating destiny and purpose. 
I recommend using essential oils on a daily basis, actually more routinely like morning, noon, and evening to strengthen the physical body from environmental elements that weaken our immunity and suppress our mind, body and spirit. 
My sessions are done via phone and in person. My goal is to create a live meetup monthly where we can discuss our blocks, find support and create monthly goals and awareness together.

Our focus is to grow and build a community of like-minded people in the New York Metropolitan and surrounding areas.

Our aim is to facilitate relationships and dialogue to ultimately improve our transportation system.

Members will engage in relevant discussions and activities within and without the city.

Activities include community outreach programs to raise awareness relating to issues such as cleanliness and safety on the subways and buses.

Membership benefits include 30-day Unlimited MetroCards, New York City Pass, and free admission to all our future events. It's like having the keys to the city!

results.description:
What is Covet?  Covet is a mobile app game (iphone, ipad, ipod, or android phone) for fashion inspiration.  Players can shop and style with real brands and best of all enter fashion challenges with other fashion gurus or wannabees.  It's a competitive bunch but we also like to have fun and share our closets (at least in the game)!

I know there are plenty of Covet Fashion players in the NYC/NJ areas so I thought I would start a meet-up group for those of us who want to share our love of fashion, game playing, and other fun hobbies.

This group is for 21+ adults.  Please no solicitations for products or services.
results.name: Covet Fashion Addicts (Those who love the game!)

results.description:
Hi my name is Monifa and I am a self-professed Francophile. For years I've traveled to France trying to improve my French only to lose most of it when I returned to New York. Well, I've decided to change that...I'm starting the Harlem French Club! 

Have you ever wished that you would have stuck with your high school or college French classes so that you would now be fluent? Hmmm, did you let that dream of being fluent fade away because you didn't have anyone to practice with? Do you know that there are 38 countries outside of France where French is the official language....think of all the possibilities where you can speak French while traveling around the world to enrich your cultural experience! That's freaking huge!! (C'est freaking énorme!!) 

The Harlem French Club will meetup to learn and practice speaking French; learn about French culture in France, as well as learn about the countries where French is the official language…..including the 26 countries in Africa!!! Having spent time in West African French speaking countries, this will be an interesting and exciting experience.

The Harlem French Club will also go to movies, restaurants; cultural events around the city and meet native speakers from around the francophone world!

Merci et j'espère vous voir bientôt!

Monifa
results.name: The Harlem French Club

results.description:
I have had plenty of experience dating online. I have been asked many times, by fellow female friends how to navigating through online dating sites. It was suggested that I widen the circle.

I am encouraging other middle-aged women ages 50-60 to join this group.  We can share, discuss our experiences in addition to offer advice to each other. 


Until we actually schedule a Meetup, please follow the "Discussion" forum. Feel free to reply and add your experience. I started posting a couple topics and sharing my experience.


Pictures of potential dates will NOT be posted online.  We will have occasional gatherings to meet in New York and Connecticut. It will a nice out for women who would like to share ....

results.description:
Welcome! We’re excited you’re thinking about joining us for Running & Spirituality. It doesn’t matter where you are on your fitness or faith journey: what matters is you’re open to growing in fitness and faith. 

Here’s some information about our group...

Purpose: We’ll cultivate a habit of growing in fitness and faith through purposeful running and spiritual reflection. By gathering together every week, we’ll support and challenge each other as we grow. We’ll come away with a faster times,  richer perspectives and new friends!

Gatherings: We’ll meet for 45 minutes to learn and discuss the spiritual topic of the week. Topics include motivation, training and teamwork from a Christian perspective. We’ll then go for a walk/run at a pace and distance that matches your level.

Day & Time: Saturdays 8:30am-10am for 9 weeks

Place: Lower level of Saints Peter & Paul Church, corner of 4th & Hudson Streets in Hoboken

Training & Reflection: Each of us will follow a basic training plan that we create for ourselves. In conjunction with our walks/runs during the week, we’ll reflect on the topic & questions of the week and write down insights in our journal. We’ll be invited to share our reflections at the beginning of the next gathering.

Race: To celebrate our experience together, we’ll participate (or race!) in the Jingle Bell Jog at 9am on Saturday, December 5. If you do see yourself sticking with this group, please register right now as this wildly popular race sells out quickly. You can register here: http://www.nyrr.org/races-and-events/2015/jingle-bell-jog

Questions? Contact Charlie at charlie.bates@spphoboken.com.


Thank you for joining us!
results.name: Hoboken Running & Spirituality Meetup

results.description: Welcome!  This group was formed to provide an opportunity for us city folk to take advantage of the great hikes just outside the city. It's a beautiful region we live in - let's enjoy it together! Most of our meet ups will take place off of the train route and will be followed by happy hour - what better way to end a hike :) Hope to see you on the trails with us!
results.name: New York Hiking Meetup

results.description:
The launching of the Rainey Leadership Experience is named after a woman who had a committed belief in the strength, tenacity and power of women. Her legacy was the motivation to start this journey to form a coalition of women who share a common vision to empower themselves and one another while taking part in positive impactful activities for transformational growth and to cultivate the leader within us all. 

We will have empowering discussions about topics that are of interest.  For our kickoff in October we will acknowledge Domestic Violence Awareness month.  We will engage in poetry writing exercises and share our stories about overcoming challenges and seeking our truths. Speakers will join us to  inform and uplift our spirits and we will engage in other fun, empowering and bonding activities, from sharing our skills and talents with one another to attending self defense classes and embarking on a self esteem and team building retreat.

Are you seeking: 

• social, spiritual and professional connections?

• purposeful personal development?

• to be surrounded by like minded positive, supportive and empowering women?


**Please note: We strongly encourage interested members to include profiles with face pictures
results.name: The Rainey Leadership Experience

results.description: The Learning Lab Is About Connection and bringing people together for workshops, talks, and events to explore and experiment with the complexities of being human — our inner worlds, our professional selves, our creative expression, our relationships, our bodies, emotions and minds — with a vision of creating a healthier, more integrated, and sustainable world. Since all change comes from within, people are invited to connect more deeply inside themselves to uncover and experience new ways of being who they most naturally are.

results.description:
FOREVER YOUNG (45ish) AFRICAN AMERICAN  CLUB.

FOREVER YOUNG!! 
This Club was created  to encourage  Men and Women (45 years and older)to get out of the house, meet new people, socialize, and enjoy life to the fullest. We want members to have a sense of belonging. A Club that meets 1-2 times per month with liked minded and interest minded members. Our goal is to enjoy life NOW.


All are welcome to join. Please join us if you would like to meet other  African American  in the Metro Area and Beyond.

Men/women/seniors/ visitors/tourist/ retirees/professionals/entrepreneurs/community group members/ church group members/employed/unemployed/etc.
If you are looking to make friends with fun loving and positive people, then this is the Club for you.


Events and Activities of  Cultural interest:

The City has a lot to offer and we are going to explore all the City's hidden gems.

Concerts/plays/party get together/ trips/cruises/ community events/park events/movies/church events/boat rides/family events/casino/bingo/tennis/ seminars/lunch/ brunch/movie/spoken word/adult round table talk/ travel/etc. The possibilities are endless.


 DON’T LET MONEY STOP YOU FROM JOINING!
We’ll search for discounts that are available to our group members.
(Senior discounts, group discounts, coupon programs, club discount program, restaurant discounts, etc.


SUGGESTIONS ARE WELCOME!!

If you have a suggestion for an event, please share .
If you have information of a discount program , please share it with the group. We're here to make friends, participate, save money whenever possible and have lots of fun. 


 REQUIREMENTS:
All members are required to participate in events as often as possible. The more times the better.

Club will meet 1-2 times per Month. This will give members enough time to plan for  events.

 
RULES AND REGULATIONS:
1) An Annual Membership Dues of $8:00  are required before or after the Trial period. (Trial Period 14 days).  Dues are Once per year. However,FOR 1ST EVENT, DUES ARE REQUIRED.

2) Annual Payments are accepted in person or online. (Once per year).
3) Dues help to defray the cost to Meetup.com, purchasing membership in discount clubs, and organizing the monthly operation of this Club
4) Please be mindful of Organizers time and effort.
5) Please be courteous to all Club Members.
6) A NO SHOW after RSVP is not acceptable. You’ll be REMOVED after 2 NO SHOWS.
7) Lateness is not acceptable.
8) Please remember that I value  YOU. You’ll always feel welcome in this Club..

 
Thank you for your support.
I hope to meet you at an event soon.

 
PLEASE JOIN TODAY!
Best regards.
Laurel
results.name: FOREVER YOUNG (45ish) AFRICAN AMERICAN   CLUB

results.description:
As a business owner or entrepreneur, are you serious about using networking to grow your business?

Networking matters whether you want new customers, repeat business, referrals or attention of potential investors. However, it is seldom taught anywhere and consequently most networkers fail to get adequate return out of their investment in business networking meetings. Business networking is not about exchanging cards!

There are tools such as elevator pitches, one-on-ones, strategic alliances, follow ups and social media that you need to master. Whether you are a pro or a newbie, our tools help you tremendously in honing your business networking skills. Our events are quality events that help you grow into a power networker who gets real business out of networking meetings. We also strive to create a synergistic referral network for you. At our events you can: 

 • Mingle with like minded individuals and create strong business relationships.

• Reach everyone in the meetup through elevator pitches.

• Take part in our highly successful interactive educational programs.

• Learn more about the mindset and skills of business ownership.

• Learn about and create strategic alliances.

• Become a spotlight speaker and promote your business. 

 About myself: I have been organizing one of the highest ranked NY Connect and Grow business networking group on meetup with 4500+ members and felt a need of a networking group which teaches people how to network. Looking forward to meet you at our next event!
results.name: NY How To Make Business Networking Work

results.description:
Business Developers of Morristown welcomes business representatives and business owners to join in every Wednesday morning as we work to build relationships that lead to increased business through warm referrals and introductions. The group was established 10+ years ago and typically has 20-40 business professionals in attendance every week. Stop by for breakfast at the Hanover Marriott, bring a thick stack of business cards with you, and make more quality professional contacts in the local community. This is a great way to get visibility for you and your business locally as it's somewhat like having a sales/marketing/mentoring/resource team! 

We are BNI-affiliated, value the philosophy of "Givers Gain", and are committed to helping one another succeed. BNI chapters are allowed to have only one profession to avoid conflict - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business - effectively locking out the competition. Please feel free to contact us to see if your category is currently open in our chapter! To see which categories we already have filled go to our BNI Website

We are actively looking for the following categories: Advertising, Air/Water Purification, Alternative Energy, Architect, Carpet Cleaner, Florist,  Payroll Service, Restoration Damage and Cleanup.

results.description:
Loss of Spouse, Partner, Sibling, Friend…
Grieving is a universal part of life; it is also very personal. We need to be in the company of others who understand. It is helpful to be in a respectful, caring and guiding environment in order to make the necessary transitions that deep losses challenge us with. This group offers a safe place where members can “just be” or share, and to support others and be supported as well. Family and Friends often don't get it, have their own issues, or make us feel like we are burdening them.

The fee is waived if you have eligible health insurance; out of pocket the fee is $20.00.

results.description:
Discover the Benefits of Buddhist Meditation with an Ordained Buddhist Monk 

Have you ever wanted to meditate but don’t know where to start? Do you have an interest in Buddhist teachings but wanted to learn from a live human being rather than Wikipedia? Buddhist monk and teacher Bhante Saddhasara is excited to be able to offer bi-weekly meditation and discussion sessions that will help you reduce your level of stress and bring you a peace of mind which is sadly lacking for most of us living in the urban jungle. 

Whether you have absolutely zero experience with meditation or Buddhism or are a seasoned pro, come and join us every Saturday at 06:00pm for a short meditation and discussion session. This Meetup is offered free of charge as a gift of the Dhamma (the Teaching of the Buddha) so please come and invite your friends. Wishing you every good blessing along your path and we hope to see you at our next get together! 

About Bhante Saddhasara 

Bhante Saddhasara joined the Mahamevnawa Meditation Monastery in Sri Lanka in 2005, became a novice in 2006 under Ven. Kiribatgoda Gnanananda Thero, and after two years of study and practice, attained High Ordination in 2009. After three more years of study, he had begun to develop a deep understanding of insight and tranquility techniques. In 2012 he was asked to begin and to organize a meditation center in Tampa, Florida to provide training to all those who wished to learn. The center was to be non-denominational; anyone of any religion could come and study the practices. Bhante Saddhasara also offered a Recovery Program for those suffering from addiction; an introductory mindfulness program for children; a prison program; and, throughout Florida and throughout the U.S.A, he also gave lectures and provided mindfulness and meditation teaching, as well as private counseling to adults and to youths of all ages. Bhante Saddhasara speaks fluent English and very much enjoys the back and forth of his conversations with Americans.
results.name: Manhattan Buddhist Meditation Group

We're winter enthusiasts and we're serious about snow quality. Gore's energy-efficient snowmaking equipment spans 95% of our resort, so each run, each turn, and each day is great.  Enjoy winter with the whole Gore Mountain family and experience how beautiful it is here!  (and how fun the glades are after a snowstorm, the exquisite view from Cloud on a bluebird day, or the southern sunshine of the never-ending Topridge trail)

results.description: Lesbian Coming Out Group Therapy Support Group at Blanton Peale Counseling Center - currently forming. Coming out is a life-changing process accompanied by a need for support. This group is intended to provide interactive support in a safe space. Members will have an opportunity to share their experiences, challenges, fears and aspirations with other women of all ages (17 and up) who may be at various stages in their coming out journey. We’ll look at what coming out means and how to navigate the process, being mindful of the fact that each person’s experience is unique. The group may discuss family, homophobia, social norms, relationships and dating, sexual fluidity, coming out at work, labeling, and/or any other relevant topics of interest to the group. topics.name: Forex Expert Advisors and Managed Accounts

results.description:
Meet Up Goals

We want everyone in our meet up to be making money. 

If not we want to know why: 

• Are you under capitalised?

• Are your stop losses unrealistic?

• Is your technical analysis working against you?

This is by far and away the most unique and interesting approach to forex trading you will find in New York. 

Come and meet traders that have worked on some of the biggest bank forex trading teams in the world. Focusing on most markets: forex, stock indices, commodities, and metals, this group has it all and can demonstrate profitability. 

Meet Up Agenda

Since there's been no readily available 'source' of experienced information in the market most traders bounce from one approach to another, waste a gazillion hours watching webinars from 'so-called experts' and continually experiment with 'miracle trade systems'. 

Trading is a journey that should always grow and develop as you learn more about the market and about yourself. But it's extremely important to have the 'Foundation' knowledge: understand how the market works, how the main players (the bankers) analyse and execute their trades. 

Once you have this foundation you can then apply all sorts of methods and tools to 'enhance' your performance. You'll find things that are a complete waste of time and others that are pure gold! 

Sharing Our Experience

This meet up is all about sharing the 'foundation' knowledge to get you on the path to success as a trader. We hope to meet fellow traders and share trading strategies and styles which can hopefully improve all of our performance. 

Whether you are interested in learning to trade or finding ways to invest your money in trading, a visit to this meetup is all you'll need to get started: beginner, intermediate and professional traders and investors are all welcome.

At the very least it's a great opportunity to meet like-minded people and share a few trading stories from the investment banking days whilst having a few drinks!

Come along and let's meet up.... I can assure you it'll definitely be worth your while!
results.name: New York Forex Day Trading Group

results.description: About North Arlington French Bulldog Expectations and requirements for being a member in our group: 1) First and foremost, this group was formed to be a place for French Bulldogs and their owners to socialize safely and in a fun environment; the North Arlington French Bulldogs Meetup is not a platform for business, hobby or extracurricular activities regarding any sort of breeding or for-profit dealings. Yes, this includes requests or propositions to stud, sell or buy a dog. Any mention of things eluding to such, whether at the Meetups or on our webpage, will be grounds for removal from the group. 2) This group is comprised of many FRIENDLY, non-dominant or aggressive Frenchies, and we want to keep it that way. Thus while this group is meant for socializing dogs and we do understand that some who are new to the group, or being around other dogs in general, may be overwhelmed at first, we will not tolerate a continual over-aggressor and said party will be asked respectfully to refrain from coming again until their dog is more comfortable in larger-scale situations. 3) Each owner is responsible for the dog(s) they bring. This means you are to be watching, aware and on top of YOUR dog's behavior and actions at all times, specifically their attitudes and cleanliness. While we encourage socializing amongst the human participants, this is ultimately about the dogs' enjoyment, and parents must be steadfast in the monitoring of their personal dogs during play time to make sure that everything is going smoothly and that all dogs are having fun. As stated, over-aggressors will not be tolerated; this includes dogs who hump/mount/chase excessively or with aggression, instigate issues with others or actually aggressively bark at, growl or bite other dogs. Additionally, accidents (poop, pee, vomit or otherwise) are the responsibility of each owner to clean up immediately. We often times meet at indoor locations as well as nice community dog parks where we, the North Arlington French Bulldogs Meetup, are responsible for picking up after ourselves in order to be eligible to utilize the spaces. YOU are responsible for cleaning up after your dog promptly, no one else! 4) We require that the health of the dogs who attend Meetups be of the highest standard!! No puppies under the age of 5 months are allowed due to their compromised immune systems and ability to carry and pass germs along more readily than older dogs. Additionally, dogs are not welcome to attend Meetup if their vaccinations are not current (all dogs should be wearing collar and tags for verification) and up to date for their age, if they are in Heat or showing any signs of being close to a breeding cycle, if they've been experiencing or exposed to ANY SIGNS of illness within the last week, or if there are any open sores present on the day of the gathering. 5) Meetups are generally held once a month at varying locations in and around North Arlington, NJ. We do our best to meet in convenient spots, and we are always looking for suggestions of large places our members would like to see us go. Indoor locations are generally only utilized if necessary per the weather, and we try to choose dog parks based on their level of public activity/cleanliness/safety as well as the ability to separate small and large breeds from each other. Please understand that this group is solely facilitated by Frenchie owners; no professional trainers or organizers host these events, so while we do our best to keep everything in line and running smoothly, there are times when we may not be able to meet due to extenuating circumstances and/or things happen that are out of our control. We strive to avoid those times, but we appreciate your flexibility and willingness to go with the flow. 6) Membership to the North Arlington French Bulldogs costs $12 per year. This fee goes towards the rental of any indoor spaces we may meet at throughout the year as well as covering the fee that Meetup.com charges us to use this site for facilitation of the group. In the event that our fund is running low I will ask members to help contribute to the cost of the indoor meetups. Any overage after all monies are collected, will be donated to the French Bulldog Rescue Network for their efforts to rescue and rehabilitate French Bulldogs throughout North America who aren't as lucky as ours. 7) Awesome members make for awesome Meetups!! We are happy to have all who are happy to abide by the rules and be upstanding members of the group!! Remember The Golden Rule, and we'll see you at the next North Arlington French Bulldogs Meetup!!
results.name: North Arlington French Bulldogs Meetup

results.description: This group is for the skeptic seeking to understand the composition and evolution of mind and matter. It's a forum for sharing and discussing new research and exciting advances in theoretical physics and computational biology. Several approaches to unifying quantum mechanics with general relativity, influenced in part by the discovery of the holographic principle, prompt us to break up spacetime itself into chucks (the same way we break down matter into particles). Matter and the laws of physics, then, emerge from the changing of the states of these chunks based on the states of neighboring chunks, as though our universe is one large cellular automaton - a computer program. I recommend the paper by Tommaso Bolognesi entitled "Algorithmic Causal Sets for a Computational Spacetime," which can be found in Hector Zenil's collection of essays "A Computable Universe: Understanding and Exploring Nature as Computation." There's also a TV program named Closer to Truth that dedicates some episodes to exploring information as the fundamental reality and the universe as a computation. But wait, I thought matter and energy are fundamental!?! Well, "Thermodynamic entropy and Shannon entropy are conceptually equivalent: the number of arrangements that are counted by Boltzmann entropy reflects the amount of Shannon information one would need to implement any particular arrangement..." of matter and energy. There is a proof by contradiction that everything (matter, mind, and processes) is composed of information, and there is another proof by contradiction that information cannot be reduced to matter. If information is the fundamental reality and the complexity of physics emerges from simplicity, it prompts a scientific paradigm shift from a top-down to a bottom-up understanding of nature. In the study of the mind, Tononi's Integrated Information Theory is one example of an approach to resolve the hard problem of consciousness using information as the fundamental ingredient. I recommend the paper "Is Consciousness Computable? Quantifying Integrated Information Using Algorithmic Information Theory." Gregory Chaitlin's metabiology is an interesting attempt to model evolution in the framework of algorithmic information theory. Let's see if we can pull together the pieces of the puzzle of existence and evolution.
results.name: Digital Philosophy, Consciousness, and Quantum Gravity

results.description:
What is StartupBlink?

StartupBlink is an interactive global startup ecosystem map with tens of thousands of entities listed including Startups, Coworking spaces and Accelerators.

StartupBlink allows startup entities to blink their recent news, receive relevant information and connect with each other based on their stated needs. http://startupblink.com

Who organizes the events?

The events are organized by the local startup community (That means You!). Our meetup groups have a community leader (Please let us know if you are interested to become one), and random events are welcomed as well, so please let us know if you want to organize an event and we will post it. All meetups are according to term of use as can be seen on Startupblink.com

What should you expect from our Meetups?

StartupBlink's meetups are focused on helping startups grow their business by supplying them with insightful information from startup leaders in the local community, and facilitating connection with other entrepreneurs to create and discover potential synergies.

Who should join this Meetup?

We welcome everyone with interest in their local startup ecosystem to join, including startup founders, Co-working and Accelerators staff and anyone who is interested to learn more and take active part in their local startup community.
results.name: StartupBlink New York

This new group is designed for divorcing parents with children to network, share information and build a community for establishing their new norm.

While all are welcome to join the group, whether early or late in the process or through and clear, the main focus is connecting parents.  It's a difficult time with myriad issues to navigate and there's no better resource than other parents facing similar circumstances.

Both Moms and Dads are welcome to join.

Please message me with questions, comments or suggestions.  Additional parents are needed to help organize the group, so please reach out if you are interested in contributing your time, skills or expertise.

This Meetup Group is for anyone interested in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics). Whether you are a student interested in learning more about a STEM field or a professional who wants to improve your skills and knowledge and advance your career, this is the group for you. 

We will hold events about cybersecurity, engineering, entrepreneurship, and more. Join our group and you will be presented with great opportunities to learn from experts and network with professionals in your field.

These events will be hosted by the New York Institute of Technology and will take place primarily in Manhattan and Long Island.
results.name: New York Engineering and Computer Science Meetup

results.description: Who is it for? Technology is advancing at a rapid pace. Established companies and startups alike work hard to capitalize on these technology development to be the most competitive in the market. At the same time, global regulators struggle to understand and pass laws regarding these technologies, sometimes providing vague guidance, sometimes overly restrictive. But in every case, in any country, and for any business operations companies are required to comply with the laws. Given the rapid developments and complexity of cyber security and technology regulation, when companies get it wrong, they often face damages including fines, litigation costs, repetitional damages, incarceration and/or shut down of operations. This forum is to help application/platform designers, startups and established businesses alike discuss and gain a better understanding of the cyber security and technology requirements that they are facing. Anyone is welcome that is looking to understand or share advice on existing or upcoming regulations applicable to certain technologies, business operation requirements, platform design, and more. What are we discussing? This forum is created to discuss and provides assistance with the following concerns: 1.) What are the technology and cyber security requirements already in place for my product design / business operations? I feel like I must be missing something... 2.) I want to start / continue a business in a relatively new field of technology and am afraid I'll get fined or shut down before I've even come close to making it. What are the regulations and where are they headed? (e.g. How do I understand existing regulations and the trajectory of global government regulation in these developing sectors like drone/UAV, crypto currency, machine/artificial intelligence and more...) 3.) I know that I am required to do this one thing for my business/product design, but I don’t know how. How are other people doing it? And how do I know if I have to do it in another country? 4.) I wish I could talk to the people making the technology and cyber security laws for my industry (e.g. FinTech, HealthTech, etc...) to tell them what the tech is really like in my business, and maybe get some understanding of what they are getting at with their laws! How can I do that? ...and more. How are we meeting? Each meeting will consist of a forum providing compliance advice for a specific aspect of the technology sector (e.g. WCAG guidelines for website/app design, payment systems compliance issues, cryptocurrency issues, etc...), followed by a Q&A for items to be discussed either at that meeting or answered in the following meeting. The meetings will start in November and will be held on a monthly basis. We look forward to seeing you there! For any questions you would like to submit to discussion, please feel free to e-mail the organizers at info@helm.global
results.name: CATCH: Cyber and Technology Compliance (w/ Helm)

results.description: So I am new to this, but let me try to describe what I am looking to do. I am a father of an amazing 16 month old boy who is the center of my universe. I work Mon-Fri, dusk till dawn saving for all the wonderful things we want to provide our son with. This leaves me little time to connect with other parents and to meet other parents that share the same family focused lifestyle that we live. Now we all know how it goes...Lots of friends and going out and social time before the baby...but after the baby comes, you just don't have the time to do all of that anymore and those friends without kids seem to drift away slowly but surely...So this is the reason I am starting this group. I'm a dad who loves football (especially fantasy football and watching football on Sundays), loves going out to eat, loves dressing my son up as cute as possible to get the most people to compliment him as possible when I take him out (admit it, we all do it!). I'm looking to meetup with easy going people who will connect with the much more simplistic lifestyle of having kids but still want to meet up and have fun once every week or two. Kids are welcome for any meetups, I mean heck, that's the whole purpose I'm posting this is because we are parents! We can meet at parks, restaurants, houses, etc... Essentially wherever people feel will be best. Just a dad, looking to connect with other dads. Sunday football outings with or without the kids would definitely be a plus! :)

results.description: This is a support group for people who find it difficult to fall asleep and stay asleep. This group is open to adults (18 or older) only. Sleep is a phenomenon of the mind. For sleep to occur the mind needs to be in a relaxed state. Once that state is achieved sleep occurs naturally, by itself. However, it is not possible for us to force our mind to relax. How then do we relax our mind? Certain tools and techniques are available – Yoga, breathing Techniques and meditation – that help us get rid of stress and negative emotions. These techniques calm the mind and allow us to get a good night's sleep. Lifestyle also has a big impact on one’s stress level, state of mind and quality of sleep. In group meetings we will explore all these.

Si te gusta bailar, pasear por la montaña, probar nuevos restaurantes, echarte unos traguitos, tomarte un cafecito o cualquier otra cosa, este es el grupo para ti. La idea es que sea un amviente abierto donde podamos conectar personas con los mismos intereses, asi que si tienes sugerencia para un evento por favor escribeme!

Ya que el grupo es nuevo no he planeado nada por ahora pero en lo que se vaya uniendo gente ire viendo.

Acerca de mi: yo naci y me crie en Venezuela, pero llevo ya 7 años en Estados Unidos viviendo entre California y Texas. Soy ingeniera y trabajo en el area de eficiencia energetica. Me encanta salir a bailar y a pasear por la ciudades donde vivo.

If you want to go dancing, grab dinner or drinks (including coffee), go hiking in the mountains, check out an exhibit or a concert, or simply have a wine and cheese night with girlfriends, this is the place for you. I am open to activity suggestions, so feel free to message me.

Group for younger widows/widowers to have support

results.description:
This group is for anyone who has lost their spouse/partner and wants to be with other people who "get it". The group will meet in a restaurant so we can have fun social time while getting to know each other. All members will be able to post any activity that members would like to do and join in on. I hope to have all members feel comfortable to post anything that they are doing and would like someone to do it with.. such as a movie, show , walk, etc... We can be there for each other... through the loneliness and through the fun times..

    We are NOT a support group in that formal manner but we DO support each other by conversing and sharing our feelings and what we did in the same situation.

I visited another group that was an hour away and was inspired to start a group in this area. I felt the comradery  between the members and saw how much fun they had being together.

My vision for this group is that we will gain friends who we can do things with, plan other activities for the group and combat the loneliness that comes from losing our spouse. I lost my husband 9 months ago and understand completely how walking this path feels. Lets walk it together!
results.name: Central NJ  Widows/ Widowers Meetup

results.description:
The purpose of the group is to combine our efforts and help those in need.

We are not millionaires, nor do we expect any reward for our gifts.....we simply believe in pooling our collective resources to help others who need help. 

How about making small miracles for local recipients in NY or NJ by providing anonymous gifts? 

The recipients of our gifts would include individuals who are simply experiencing temporary financial hardship and have felt on hard times or an individual lacking the means to obtain a basic essential and just need a helping hand to change their current circumstances for the best. 

In this day and age, we all know a small act of kindness goes a long way....In my opinion, a helping hand is by far the best hand to have and give.  Do you want to make small miracles happen?

1. How great would it be to help someone pay their mortgage, rent or utilities for a month or so until they get back on their feet?

2.  How awesome would it be to pay the tuition of a student anonymously or help them pay off or down a student loan?

3.  How beautiful would it be to buy groceries for a family for several months?

4.  How wonderful would it be to help someone pay a medical bill or pay off a lingering small debt?

5.  How amazing would it be to purchase an item or basic essential an individual desperately need, however, they are unable to afford due to hardship?

6.  How fantastic would it be to purchase computers, equipment or supplies for a local student, school or charity.

The list goes on....... Even on a small scale, our collective acts of human kindness and compassion will make a difference.

Members will brainstorm on ideas and/or recommend local individuals in need for us to help collectively and anonymously.  The miracle begins thereafter.....

I strongly believe a group of committed people can truly make a difference in the lives of many.  An impact of which will last a lifetime and many generations to come. Lets give back!

Thanks for your time and consideration!
results.name: I want to give back! Anonymous Philanthropist of NY & NJ

Welcome to The Run Club®. Where Run Club® members from the Bayside area meet up for early/late runs daily.

Who should Join? The Run Club® is ideal for beginning Baysiders who want to join runs on a daily basis to improve their speed, endurance and eventually participate in upcoming NYC 5k races.

 30 Runners Club®: Run Club® members who participate in at least 30 consecutive daily runs a month will be rewarded with entry fee reimbursements to any one 5k or 10k race within a 6 month period.

We have gathered together a powerful blend of Moving and Standing practices that Work to open the internal energy channels and move the Chi thru out the body. results.description:
Soul Writers! This Meetup group is for those of us who want to nourish our souls, express ourselves, and tap into our creativity. We'll get together and discuss it all! 

We’ll unleash our words onto paper, share our writing with a supportive community, and most importantly have fun!  Writing creates a space for us to process our experiences in a way that we hadn’t before and uncover new insights. During each Meetup, we'll have time to network, connect, and learn about what everyone is up to! 

Everyone has a story to tell, we look forward to hearing yours. <3 


“Writing, like all forms of expression, demands that we look at things. In the face of our denial, at the risk of our comfort, it demands that we see. When we can write clearly about a person or event, it is because we have the willingness or the clarity to see it. Seeing it, we can name it. Naming it gives us a sense of possession, at least of our own experience.”–Julia Cameron, Vein of Gold
results.name: Soul Writing Group

results.description:
We are a sophisticated, well-designed yet unpretentious guild for those cultured, polished lesbians that have grappled to find equivalently high-quality significant others and equally minded lesbian friends. The Society was founded on the belief that NYC’s finest lesbians have been really struggling to find equally high quality contemporaries, given a dearth of refined outlets to meet.

The Cosmopolitan Lesbian Society is a Society of Leaders; whether CEOs, entrepreneurs, and businesswomen, or scientists, PhDs and doctors, we strive to challenge, sharpen, and inspire one another. We invite you to revel and luxuriate in, to be motivated and moved by, the company of lovely lesbians in our elegant and chic settings. 

Mind you: this is not a ‘league.’ Nor a ‘club.’ Neither is it an organization. And certainly -- not a ‘group.’ It is nothing less than a Society of smart, classy Women. 

The Society becomes official on 1 January, 2016, when its A-round of Funding closes. (Feel free to follow up with me to inquire how the capital will be spent in fiscal 2016.) After this date, the Society will permit members by interview and on a dues-paying basis only. At that point, women must be nominated to interview.

And please, mark our event on Saturday, November 7th, in your diary as one to reminisce in years to come as ‘oh that night…’ with "ahh, those Women" 

The Society's activities will include: 

• museum openings + cocktails

• guest speakers including diplomats, educators, entrepreneurs, actors, authors, philanthropists, and artists

• private cocktail parties and dinners hosted at fabulous restaurants/bars

• movie pre-screenings

• book discussions featuring the authors

• sports events (i.e. bootcamps, private classes at boutique studios like SoulCycle or Barry's Bootcamp, etc)

• small dinner parties 

• summer house rental

• winter ski house rental

• Caribbean trip 

• two long international trips each year - i.e. safari, Asia, etc.  

• More activities - per your recommendations - will be added 

<br>

Please feel free to contact Andrea@CLSociety.com with ideas or questions.  

Twitter: CosLesSociety
Instagram: CosLesSociety
results.name: Cosmopolitan Lesbian Society: Smart & Sophisticated

results.description:
Join industry thought leaders for an interactive discussion on next generation data center architectures, innovations and how others are addressing today’s data center challenges, with topics including:

• Data Center Hyperconvergence

• Data Center Consolidation

• Data Center Virtualization

• Data Center Orchestration and Automated Provisioning

• Data Center Interconnect and Distributed Cloud Environments

About:

Who Should Join:

results.description:
https://youtu.be/lvHLCbcSSdg

Do you see yourself as a "thinker for world change?" 

Join a no-cost event that will give you a taste of this visionary networking experience! http://inspiredleadersacademy.com/inspired/lid-kickoff-b/

Maybe you work in an organization and have a burning concept you want to bring to market. Maybe you're an academic, eager to get on a TED stage; or a doctor, psychologist, coach or other expert wanting to showcase your expertise. Maybe you're already an entrepreneur--business or social--and have a new idea that could impact even greater change.

Have you ever truly found a networking group you enjoyed? One that was as different as you?

Almost all follow a tired formula of ho-hum speakers, forced, superficial encounters, a mismatch of attendee needs and interests, a focus on quantity, not depth--and (really) bad chicken.

I'm Lizabeth Phelps, founder of Inspired Leaders' Academy, and the entrepreneurs I work with are spurred every day by pretty big missions and these kinds of events leave them profoundly empty. 

That is why I have developed Leaders in Dialogue--Visionary Networking for World-Changing Thinkers.

It is for those who need a "new class" of networking experience that emphasizes *peer-to-peer* knowledge, cutting-edge discussion, future visioning, thought leadership and collaboration.

It is based on the discussion-type gatherings attended by the great philosophers and inventors of Europe's Age of Enlightenment, who succeeded in large part because of the discussion groups they attended.

Leaders in Dialogue tosses out the wearisome networking models of today and reaches back in time to a model that once changed the world--and is visionary enough for the NEW "age of enlightenment" that is upon us now.

Become a dues-based member and you become part of an "alliance"--a brother/sisterhood, really--where your business connections are made from deep interaction. 

Nothing is superficial here! The benefits are numerous, and unlike anything offered by conventional models.

To register for a free event where you can sample this new group, go here:  http://inspiredleadersacademy.com/inspired/lid-kickoff-b/
results.name: "Leaders In Dialogue" Entrepreneurial Networking

I need to recruit professionals with important skills and then build the first bug-out locations in Queens and Brooklyn (this is a place where we can easily travel to, rather than running into the woods with a tent). Instead of staying at a public shelter, this will be a place where we can all stay safe during a crisis with people we know and trust. Given the number of people joining this group, I will decide whether to expand to more locations. So spread the word! Let's live happily and comfortably during times of crisis.

results.description:
I know that this site is mostly for 'activity-buds' ---- the kind of people with whom you share some hobbies, sporadic time commitments, and the kind of light conversation that will never delve into real intimacy. That's not what I'm looking for. And damn the preposition that brought me to this point. 

I have been out-of-college for nearly a decade and my closest friends are not in the city or even the state. I have also never had the pleasure of a group of friends and am nurturing some beautiful independent relationships where it increasingly feels like we're always just "catching up" instead of being an active part of each other's lives. I'm also tired of accepting the dooming wisdom that adults CAN'T make friends.

I want to go to bars with you (dear group of friends) and laugh until we're blue, discover new exhibits, have dinner parties, go to each other's weddings, go to hockey games, concerts, and make this friendship real. I know this is even odder than dating online but once we find each other, I'm sure we can come up with a better meet-cute group story. 

About me: Late 20's, New Yorker, brassy, works at a start-up, thinks she's funny, routinely inappropriate, struggling to even START Infinite Jest, and would dominate pop-culture questions in pub trivia. I'm too lazy to be 'basic' but am not ashamed of liking Pumpkin Spice Lattes and top 40's.

About you? Do tell.
results.name: Idealistic cynics forming a montage-worthy group of friends

results.description:
Hello Everyone,

The organizer for this meetup is an artist and academic working on a project that looks at how space is organized in New York City. The sights here reflect the ideas for balanced global operation. Looking at the iconic sights that characterize NY, while talking about what they mean, we uncover aspects of our nature as individuals and our future as a global culture.

To see and experience these dynamics we look at art in the public spaces of this city. By placing it in its cultural context we reveal or reassert  the mental structure for a global citizenry.

Each of the places visited will reveal fresh perspectives. We will organize to meet in different neighborhoods and institutions that have creative works on display. Join this community and renew your love for this city all while relating to amazing people with similar interests.

Together we will develop a more profound appreciation for this incredible city beyond all limits.

Your guide is a licensed professional and studies meaning in the things we create.
results.name: Global Citizenship in New York City

results.description:
Who we are

Hunters and sportsmen/women who are interested in learning how to begin to hunt big game (Bear, Elk, Deer, Bobcat) as well as many species of migratory waterfowl (Teal, Goose, Wood duck, Pintail etc) and upland bird (Pheasant, Dove, Quail). Lots of planning and work goes into learning how to successfully hunt for your own meat and what that means for the broader environment.

Find us on Twitter @nychunting

What we do

We have three different types of meetups here.

1) Hunting knowledge meetups

2)Sport shooting and practice meetups (Trap, Skeet) (List of surrounding facilities)

3)Hunting Meetups and Mentorship

Navigating hunting can be difficult especially if you come from a family that has never hunted! This group is for beginners and experts alike looking to create community. Long traditions have been passed down from hunting families and we'd love to share all the information we've learned together. Join if one of these types of events appeals to you and you want to be part of an awesome community!


P.S. -> If you feel so inclined please send me tips for paying for hosting (Unfortunatley Meetup is not free for organizers) :)


Topics to be covered from different speakers in the community and different events: 

Hunting organizations to get involved with 

Conservancy and regulation 

Orienteering

Hunting and Technology 

Topography and GIS 

How to use a Compass 

Orienteering 

Ruts 

Seasonal behavior of individual species 

Regulations - Federal, State, City 

Where do I keep my firearms? 

How do I buy a firearm? What about a scope? 

How do I take care of my firearms? 

Physical conditioning for big game hunts 

Public vs Private Land Ownership, what that means for the hunter Harvesting your kills (Various species) - field dressing, butchering, aging, packing, cooking (Field to table) and many, many more topics to come......
results.name: New York City Hunting Meetup
