results.description:
The New York Tennis Meetup Group is a platform for tennis lovers to convene, to organize games and matches, to promote the sport of tennis, and most importantly, to have fun. We welcome all levels of players from beginners to professional coaches to join us and serve each other.

To facilitate event organizing, please observe the following guidelines:

All members must post a face recognizable picture on the profile page.
Anyone can request to be an Event Organizer (EO) as long as he/she has been active with the group. While being "active" is subjective, I would say a good attendance of 20+ without "no-show" is a good indication.
As EO, one would reserve the court, post and host the event. He can also place all RSVP on wait list from which the EO would pick out the final tennists before the event date.
As a courtesy to the EO and members on waiting list, please change RSVP well in advance. The general rule of thumb is at least 2 days before the event.
EO should post a self rating range on the event base on NTRP system, e.g. 1.5 - 2.5 for members to consider before RSVP.
EO determine cost but it must be posted on the event in advance. For amateur players, we suggest sharing the court fee and cost of new balls. To cover some intangible expenses, EO can have the liberty to charge higher than cost.
From time to time, the group shall organize free coaching session exclusively for the EOs.
Members' record showing frequent no show without cancelling will be removed from the group. Late cancellations are considered as no show. Please make sure all players who show up checkin to the meetup system.
Professional Coaches are welcomed to join us. Once recognized by the group organizer as a Meetup Coach, one can organize events just like any other EO and charge their own rate.
From time to time, the Group would organize community tennis event free to new comers in different district to promote the game. Professionals can take advantage of such events to promote their services.
If you haven’t notice, we call ourselves Tennist and our Headline is “Come serve with Tennis Meetup!”
Disclaimer: New York Tennis Meetup is an amateur platform that welcomes all tennis players. By joining our events, all participants are deemed to have agreed to the terms and conditions contained in this disclaimer, and agreed to exonerate the organizers and any other participants in the games from any liabilities, claims, including but not limited to liabilities and claims as a result of any injuries or deaths or damages arising thereof. Players joining games are at their own choosing and at their own risk.
results.name: New York Tennis Meetup Group

topics.name: Practical Application of A Course in Miracles

results.description: Channeled by the same voice that authored A Course in Miracles but in more easy to understand and perhaps more feminine language, Mari Perron's A COURSE OF LOVE speaks to the heart rather than the mind. Let's explore this important new text together from the beginning and use it as a springboard to become peaceful miracle workers. Led by CRS co-founders and ACIM Teachers/Healers Yasuko Kasaki and Christopher Pelham, this class will begin at the beginning of the book and work its way through the text week by week. It may be astonishing to hear that there is a “continuation” of A Course in Miracles, but it is true. Forty years ago Jesus dictated ACIM to the scribe Helen Schucman. More recently, over three years, he similarly dictated A Course of Love. Jesus himself referred to what he was dictating as a “continuation of A Course in Miracles.” Students of ACIM will recognize the Voice. Students of truth, whatever their background, will find that ACOL resonates with the heart. A COURSE OF LOVE builds upon the same non-dualistic thought system as ACIM, yet it is a course for the heart. ACOL and ACIM work hand-in-hand. Yet remarkably, ACOL bypasses the mind. It uses thought to go beyond thought. Those yearning to access the heart’s knowing will find help here. This is your invitation to live the purposeful, meaningful life of the new—the reality of heaven on earth. Classes are $20 and class cards are available. Students of all experience levels and backgrounds are welcome! Yasuko Kasaki has been teaching A Course in Miracles and offering spiritual counseling and healing since 1999. She has approximately 1,000 students and clients. In 2004, she opened CRS, the first and only spiritual center in New York City devoted to the study and practice of ACIM. Ms. Kasaki is the author of 21 books published by major publishers in Japan. Read more... You can listen to a sampling of Yasuko's recent guided meditations here: http://crsny.podbean.com Christopher Pelham currently serves as teaching assistant for the Monday ACIM class and will sometimes lead the group when Ms. Kasaki is away. He is the Director and a co-founder of CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing). He produces arts/cultural/educational events at the Center, leads Inner Vision Workouts, and works as a CRS Healer and teacher of A Course in Miracles. In addition to studying ACIM with Yasuko Kasaki since 2003, he studied the Spiritual Psychology of Acting with London-based teacher John Osborne Hughes and Keith Johnstone-based Improvisation with the late Gloria Maddox. Read more... Another great way to get a taste of our approach is to attend one of our free Healing meetups, each of which is open to the public: Spiritual Healing Clinic M 7 – 7:40 pm, Tu 7 – 7:40 pm and Sundays 12 – 1 pm preceding Jon Mundy's Miracles in Manhattan lectures suggested donation $20, nobody turned away Guided Meditation Tu 6:30 – 7 pm Free!
results.name: A Course of Love Study Group NYC

results.description:
We are a Qigong group, practicing Zhineng Qigong. All levels are welcome to practice and share experiences.

We all chip in to rent space at the Edgar Cayce Center. Meeting cost is a nominal $5

We started about four(4) months ago, but just recently posted on meetup. We have about 25 members, 15-20  people show up for the Tuesday meeting. Then we added a new Sunday practice session.

Zhineng Qigong was started by Dr Pang in China. Please google Zhineng Qigong and Dr Pang. It is an open system, Dr Pang was a prolific writer and researcher.

With the practice of Zhineng Qigong, we remove internal blocks, restore physical health and emotions, and build Extraordinary capabilities.

We divide our meeting in two portions. One hour of practice of level 1 exercises, LQU (Lift Qi Up) and 3CM (Three Centers Merge). For the second hour, we usually invite high level teachers/masters from around the world to give a presentation via Skype. We feel it inspires our practice and introduces us to different teaching styles.

All the masters we invite are former students of Dr Pang and are internationally acclaimed. Most have written books on ZNQG, which are available via Amazon.

So far the following teachers have appeared via Skype

master Jianshe from China

http://www.hexju.com/

teacher Hou Hee (Frank) Chan from California

http://www.chilel.com/chilel.html

teacher Ooi Kean Hin from Malaysia

https://qigongzhineng.wordpress.com/about/

master Liu from China

http://www.lifeqicenter.com/Teachers.html
results.name: New York Wisdom Qigong Meetup

results.description:
Let's play some golf together! I'm looking to put together a small-sized compatible group that would enjoy playing together once every week or two at the local public golf courses. By small-sized I mean eight or so people so we can have two foursomes. But if more people are interested then sure, we can expand. 


Although I'm mostly thinking of a group of guys playing golf, women would be welcome. My wife will likely join us sometimes also. Your spouse (or a golfing buddy) would be welcome also as space allows. As implied, this is not a singles meetup type of event. It's for people who enjoy playing golf and enjoy it that much more when playing with others. 


If you can say "yes" to most of these questions then we could be a pretty compatible group: 

1. You're a young senior ... for myself I just turned 62. While "young senior" is not a "have to have" criteria to join decide for yourself if you think you would get along with such a group. 

2. You're available during weekdays to play. ... Wanted so we can get cheaper rates. Being retired or semi-retired helps. Note: but we might play some on weekends also. 

3. You're nearby (within 7 or so miles of Cranford). ... This ties in with keeping the group small. 

4. You play in the area. ... As for me, I play at these public courses: Hyatt Hills, Ashbrook, Galloping Hills, and the Summit Muni (a par 3 course). Other courses are welcome if you have one you like. I also play at a private club but my limited membership makes it costly to play at (and only allows 3 guests at a time anyway). 

5. You can already play golf. You can be poor, mediocre, or quite good. ... So you know, my handicap is a 26. Yeah, that's on the high side but I'm getting better. 

6. You follow good golf etiquette. ... For example, you keep up your pace of play. Also, you know and follow the rules (but if you need a mulligan please take it). 

7. Good attitude. ... Even if your game is going poorly you enjoy being out and can joke around with others. 'Nuff said? I think so. 


So let's keep it simple and fun. We only have a month or so of golf left. And if it works out we can regroup next season after our initial foray this year.
results.name: Cranford Social Golf Club Meetup -- for Young Seniors

results.description: Linking with others in New York and around the world to aid the planetary shift in consciousness. This group meets, both in New York and electronically, in support of the vast meditative effort that is underway on our planet to let in the light. Our work includes meditations at the time of the new and full moon, a weekly webinar, as well as a spring conference and a seminar in the fall. The full moon meetings include a talk on themes related to the energies coloring the particular constellation under consideration, while the meetings at the new moon consist of group discussion related to the various crises confronting our world as we transition into a new age. Each meeting concludes with a group meditation through which we serve through the contacting, holding and distribution of the contacted energy to all life forms. The moments of the full and new moons each month provide the greatest opportunity for us to pause and align ourselves with the soul and, in turn, with the planetary heart center, the Spiritual Hierarchy. Through such means we cooperate with the Divine Plan or Intention for our world. Today, countless groups, large and small, meet regularly throughout the world at these interlude periods in the cycles of nature. These groups have been meeting for decades, so the work does not start anew each month but rather builds and grows upon a well-established foundation, a living nucleus of spiritual energy from which we take and to which we give. This work demands of us at all times a deepened understanding and an increased ability to penetrate to new levels of consciousness so lifting humanity as a whole. http://www.lucistrust.org/en/service_activities/start_a_meditation_group/resource_center

results.description:
The basic idea: 

• You work in tech. 

• You're in the NYC area. 

• You care about "people" issues. 

• You think the hardest problem in computing is "people". 

• You are interested in how we work; how to structure work; how to work together; how to help your colleagues succeed. 

And... There's so much to learn: 

There's a ton of books out there to get good ideas from. Too many in fact. You'll never get through them all. So, don't. Distribute the learning. 

What a meeting is like: 

We all read different "people" books. We get together every month and 2 people each present a book or a concept from a book. Their presentation can be up to 20 minutes long and then, we talk about the concepts from the presentation for a while.

We limit ourselves to 2 presentations per meetup. Each presentation can be up to 20 minutes long with an additional discussion period that can also be up to 20 minutes long. Presentations can be a general overview of a book, a discussion of a specific topic from a book or a synthesis of ideas from across a number of books.

We keep our meetings small 10-14 people max so if you RSVP and later find that you can't attend, please cancel as soon as possible. Priority for signup to any given meeting is given to attendees of the previous meeting. 

Interested in presenting?

Get some inspiration from our "books on interest" list and our list of past presentations. If you see a book you would like to present from on the past presentations list, fret not, reach out to the organizers, its quite possible that if you want to focus on a specific topic that its still available for a deeper dive.

Once you've decided on a book, message an organizer and we can work out the details.

Code of Conduct:

The Tech "People" Bookclub is dedicated to a harassment-free experience for everyone. Our anti-harassment policy can be found at: http://www.meetup.com/the-tech-people-bookclub/pages/Code_of_Conduct/
results.name: The Tech "People" Bookclub

results.description:
Who's Got Next in HR (WGNinHR) is for the tired, the bold, the innovative and ambitious HR professional. It's a Movement born out of a weariness with the status quo that puts HR leaders and doers in a box. WGNinHR is busting us out of those boxes, and breaking all paradigms. It's for those who dare to ask 'what's next?', expecting to be challenged to new levels in HR - or even outside of it...to the C-Suite and perhaps, eventually, to the top seat. After launching as a (virtual) membership organization (www.wgninhr.org), WGNinHR is now ready to establish a NY presence. If you'd like to meet like-minded HR pros looking for creative ways to advance their careers, join this growing Movement - and become a part of our Meetup.  The Meetups will include networking, light refreshments and interactive learning opportunities!

What’s in a Name?

On playgrounds across the nation, and maybe even the globe, someone is screaming out a familiar question – ‘who’s got next?!’  The question is asked of the person confident enough to step onto the court or playground, grab the ball – and then do something amazing with it.  That’s where the name for this organization came from.  Its focus is on the HR professional who dares to not only ask the ‘what’s next?’ question, but to shape the answer!

This is a Movement looking to challenge your thinking, and that of the folks who surround you who may be suffocating your career aspirations, perhaps unintentionally. The fact is, too many HR pros are convinced that they can’t aspire to more – in their fields, outside their fields, to the C-Suite and even to the CEO seat. 

This Meetup is for you.  Whether you’re the aspiring HR pro having just graduated and in your first HR gig, or the more seasoned among us with 20+ years of HR and business experience.  This is for you if you truly believe that there’s more to your career story. 

NY Trailblazers

The goal is a monthly meetup like no other.  Yes, there will be networking which is awesome. Yes, there will be refreshments to give us the energy boost at the end of a day.  But, we’ll strive for even more.  Creativity.  Innovation.  New – and quirky – thinking about old issues and hot topics which impact HR leaders aspiring for more.  Interactive learning sessions will serve as incubators for ideas that may ultimately position HR leaders as the smartest people in the room….whether it’s the conference room or the board room.

Want to Join?

If this group resonates with you, we’d love to have you! But we ask that you engage wholly and completely.  When you RSVP, keep your commitment and show up.  If you can’t, just let the organizer know at least a couple of days in advance whenever possible.  If you volunteer in this powerful Movement, it means that your colleagues are one step closer to reaching new levels because of your efforts.  We don’t take that lightly and ask that you don’t either.  The world of business needs you and we believe that your life will never again be the same as you connect with like-minded others.

Who’s Got Next?


Contact Jo Rencher at: wgninhr@optonline.net


*Stay tuned for our first Meetup Date and Location!
results.name: Who's Got Next in HR? - NY Trailblazers

results.description:
This meetup plays in a brand new indoor soccer center  - next to McCarren Park - on artificial grass.

The grass-like turf is from GreenFields, who've made more FIFA-approved fields, including MLS and NCAA pitches, than any other turf manufacturer. There's no better publicly-accessible playing surface in the five boroughs.

Join us for games at these times and days:

• Before work: weekday mornings from 6-8am.

• Lunch hours: weekdays from 12-2pm.

• Weekday evenings and weekends: while not a regular or frequent happening, stay tuned for these games when the field isn't occupied by leagues, clinics and soccer schools.

• After midnight: insomniac & shift-worker games every weeknight.

With six huge skylights, you'll be playing under natural light during the day. Indoors will almost feel like outdoors. But it'll be warm in winter, cool in summer, and always dry.

Join us for a unique soccer experience - the only of its kind in Brooklyn if not the entire city.

* If you'd like to play in a women's, co-ed, or men's league at this center or to enroll your child in our soccer school or youth league, please contact me directly at gregory@nysoccerproject.com.
results.name: Brooklyn Indoor Soccer Meetup

results.description:
Yoga (not physical Yoga but that of consciousness) may be defined as a process of conscious participation in the growth of one's consciousness.
When reading a philosophy such as The Gita, it is sometimes natural to the mind to make a delineation between the "teaching" and "real life". For example, one may read the Gita and understand it but not apply it in their corporate job. Aurobindo Ghosh, an Indian philosopher and poet said "All Life is Yoga". In This group we will explore this idea further and look for ways to apply The Gita as well as some ideas of Integral Yoga to life.

This group has the following goals:

• To explore how philosophies such as The Gita and works of Aurobindo Ghosh's Integral Yoga may be applied to routine life to give our activities a deeper meaning.

• To challenge the belief that human nature cannot change and explore how Yoga can be used not only to affect change in one's own nature (for the better) but use this change as a means of personal transformation.

• To read and explore The Gita and the literature of Aurobindo Ghosh's Integral Yoga

We are interested in flipping real estate as well as buying to hold (each month we will focus on certain areas of real estate investment). 


Every month we will invite the best speakers, coaches, educators with focus on those who don't just talk but who are in the market and are actually buying, selling, flipping and making money. We are interested in those who take action and do what they must do to thrive and succeed. 


We will meet at nice centers all over NYC with our first meeting in late October in midtown Manhattan. Be prepared to meet many cool but serious real estate investors and learn from the best of the best! Let us know if you know great speakers who actually have great track record. results.description:
The HealthCare Social Network (HCSN) was organized in February 2015 by a dedicated group of young professionals that seek to add value to the healthcare profession by connecting like-minded individuals together through a social platform.

We recognize that it is undoubtedly stressful working in the health industry, where the stakes are higher. Oftentimes this goes largely ignored, as we are trained to place the wellness of others before ours. This group is meant to encourage social bonding outside the context of work and help re-energize the passion to pursue a career in healthcare.

Through the HCSN, we hope to build a stage where professionals can acquire new perspectives through the exchange of creative ideas and discover an avenue for new opportunities and ventures. This is a place where people can find their next dream job, a place where ideas are embraced, nurtured, and followed, and a place where, together, we improve advancements in the healthcare community. What began with 4 friends and colleagues who conceived of the HCSN has flourished into a regular contingency of 70+ members!

We are the HealthCare Social Network!

This is an electric bicycle meetup for electric bicycle enthusiasts , entrepreneurs, and people who are interested in: 

• TRYING ebikes

• BUYING REBUYING RESELLING ebikes

• RENTING LEASING AND BORROWING AND LENDING ebikes, ebike businesses, and all things related

• MODDING FIXING SALVAGING ( endless sphere and hardware hacking in general) ebikes etc....

• ENCOURAGING AND LOBBYING FOR PROLIFERATION AND LEGALIZATION for consumer and commercial applications(such as cargo delivery and pedi-cabbing) . 

• Internet of Things and smart connected apps and hardware hacking for networked applications relating to ebikes. 

This meetup is also open to cross promotion with electric urban scooters , electric tricycles, and the use of these vehicles or ebikes, for travel, cargo delivery, passenger delivery, mobile advertising, mobile sales, policing, community service or other alternative uses for the superior electric motor+battery technology of ebikes. 


This meetup is also interested in direct hardware on the bike ( charger, battery, controller , battery management system, etc...) and ESPECIALLY , the Smartphone applications for ebikes and advanced sensors and tracking and digital analysis of big data from ebikes. One might call it IoT or smart-ebike or whatever. This is very much part of the ebiking world interest, so programmers and hardware hackers for controllers, battery management systems, chargers, ebike components ( electric cuttoff breaks , lighting and auxillary power plugs ) , and of course any software interacting with the battery itself. 

[This is not a meetup for electric segues, hovertraxx, electric unicycles or other toy like niche electric vehicles that are not poised to take over the worlds urban mobility sector. ]

results.description:
Have you ever walked into a gallery, barfed up your dinner, only to realize what is now splashed across the floor is of a higher aesthetic order than that which hangs on the wall? Unfortunately too many galleries are in the biz of hawking art rather than cultivating it. If possible they would frame up the remains of your recently purged spaghetti bolognese before selling it back to you, pitching its 'importance' in the sophomoric language of art-speak. Well Gotham is home to innumerable talented artists whose works go unrecognized by these self-appointed arbiters of art. And guess what folks? Throughout the year they welcome the public into their creative lairs during NYC's numerous open studio festivals. By joining TOAS (not to be confused with 'toas'- the  small painted artifacts of Australia's indigenous Diyari speaking people, see image below)

you will you get to meet artists, discuss their works, and hang out with a fun group of art lovers just like yourself. Better yet, should you buy a piece of art 100% of the proceeds go directly to the artist not some euro-trash salesman in a three size too small Armani suit. So check back frequently for the latest open studio event.
results.name: THE OPEN ARTIST STUDIOS

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Five Tribes, Kingsburg, Istanbul, Catan, Pirate's Cove, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Stone Age, Suburbia, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Lords of Waterdeep, Splendor, The Cave, and more.  

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark

results.description:
Most Sundays, at 11am

This is a new type of philosophy meetup, and I am a new type of moderator. I am calling this conclave Voki-all-joyo. Each week, on Sunday morning, we will meet for a presentation, discussion, and sharing of ideas. These ideas are meant to be about the issues most important to your heart:
 •  Why are you here?
 •  What should you believe?
 •  What should you learn?
 •  How do you succeed?
 •   What should you being doing to make the world better?
 •  How can you be happy(ier)?

This is not about doctrine, dogma, or definiteness. This is about dialectics, discourse, and discussion.

Each week a topic or theme will be presented around ideas or thoughts from the realms of science, western philosophy, eastern philosophy, and literature. I draw on the world of many great western minds, including: Thoreau, Kant, Einstein, Chomsky, Sun Tzu, Epictetus, Jung, Aquinas, Fromm, James..… and as a Sanskrit theorist I draw on many of the ancient Vedic texts, the Mahabharata, The Bhāgavata Purāṇa, the Upanishads, The Bengali poets and scholars, and many others.

Many of the topics will be about yoga, science, meditation, philosophy, and basically all things that can be used to help us explore how to both think more clearly and at the same time reside happily in the cloud of unknowing.

Each week I will offer a presentation about the topic that is no more than 17 minutes long. We will then have a discussion on the topic, and sharing time. 

So, remember to bring something that inspires you to share. It can be a piece of music, a photo, a poem, or even a short anecdote. 

I will close the session with some brief remarks, and then go to brunch, or, if the weather is nice, on a picnic. I hope you will join me ☺

About your host

My name is Atma. I speak four languages and can read and write Sanskrit. I am a behavioral scientist with a background in educational psychology. I am spiritual, but not religious. I am agnostic, but not atheistic. I am rational, but not close-minded. I am here to be of service to others. I like art, history, science, music, literature, and things that buzz or blink. I think coming together as a community on Sunday mornings has value, but I’m not into church. I want to grow and learn in the company of my peers, and friends, free from the dictates of dogma and blue hair.

Therefore, I have created Voki-all-joyo (phonetic for voki al ĝojo.) This is Esperanto (one of my favorite languages) for Call to Joy. I named it this because I am convinced that our constitutional position as spirits in a human form is to be full of joy. I aIso feel strongly that clear thinking is the best path to real joy. Please note, when I say, ‘be full of joy’, I do not mean joy in some horribly homogeneous way, like a narcotized, monolithically emotional state. I mean joy, as in a rich state of appreciation and wonder at the mystery and beauty of life. (Like the feeling you get when you find a box of Twinkies in a post-apocalyptic zombie wasteland.)

So, think of this as a pasta sea of fellow swimmers who are looking for what binds us together without being bound up by the ligaments of human speculation. Since perhaps, it is not so wise to hold dear that which is so dearly held by those who prefer not think for themselves:)

Think clearly and be grateful
(Pensi klare kaj esti dankema)

Atma

Our club greeting:
~ Ne estu schmuckie (Don’t be a schmuck)

~ Vi nek (You either)
results.name: NYC Philosophy, Science, & Spirituality Meetup

results.description:
Welcome to our sustainable food & fuel group! We started this meetup with the primary goal of sparking conversation about our nation's food and transportation fuel systems. Sustainable America is working towards large goals (reduce oil consumption by 50% and increase food availability by 50% in the next two decades) and we cannot accomplish them without involving as many like-minded individuals and groups as possible and as a result are always seeking to meetup with them. 

In addition to talking about ways to improve our food & fuel systems we want to bring people together who are interested in and willing to take action to bring about positive change. This comes in many forms, whether it is an individual deciding to turn their car off while waiting to pick up a friend instead of idling or a food service provider choosing to to donate their excess inventory at the end of a day instead of throwing it out; these are only two examples out of hundreds, maybe thousands. 

We have turned many of these actions into programs and campaigns and are always looking for opportunities to grow them or develop new ones. By building a face-to-face community, we hope to engage more of the Stamford community in our work and make our city a leader in food and transportation fuel sustainability. 

Sustainable America is a national non-profit located in Stamford, CT. We focus on our nation's food and transportation fuel systems because they are inextricably connected and not as robust as they may appear. Through educational programming and partnerships with corporations and entrepreneurs we are making a big impact as we work to reduce oil consumption and increase food availability around the country.

On behalf of the staff of Sustainable America, welcome and thank you for your interest. Feel free to reach out with any questions or comments. You can also visit our website, www.sustainableamerica.org for more info. We can't wait to meet you!
results.name: Food for thought. Fuel for change.

results.description:
Do your software projects stumble over the deployment hurdle? If so, you are not alone. Many software projects struggle to achieve consistent deployments across their environments—from Test to UAT to Staging to Production. Successful deployments must account for differences between environments; coordinate development teams and environment owners; balance schedule pressures; and create the requisite audit trail. When these challenges are compounded by error prone, inconsistent and inefficient manual processes, achieving a consistent deployment can seem impossible.

Join to learn more about DevOps best practices and network with professionals in the area.

DevOps Subject matter experts will present case studies and breakfast and lunch will be provided. 

This will be discussion based and we will discuss anything that the audience brings up!
results.name: New York DevOps Networking Meetup

results.description: The Manhattan Women’s Club (MWC) is a private social group in New York City. As you might guess, it is made up primarily of women who live in the New York metropolitan area. Yes, there IS bias here because MWC members are highly capable in the many roles they pursue – which include: chefs, friends, bankers, teachers, quilters, artists, lawyers, parents, authors, doctors, musicians, agents, philanthropists, spouses, entrepreneurs, professors, caterers, accountants, designers, producers, historians, actresses and grandparents. And probably a few Indian chiefs, too! The MWC “clubhouse” is New York City and its immediate environs because of the infinite variety, diversity and scope New York offers in terms of extraordinary things to see and do. We sometimes travel farther afield, always with a Manhattan-minded outlook. If you would like additional information about our group, go to our website: http://www.manhattanwomensclub.com

There are shows out there for all types and ages at venues across the NJ area. results.description: Educational Theater of New York, now in its 15th year, opens ‘The Gioconda Smile’ by Aldous Huxley, Monday, Oct. 26 at 6:30. The story is adapted into short scenes; after each scene is presented, the action stops, and the Presenter engages the students in a conversation about the issues they just saw. The students, then, have the opportunity to see the scene again or continue to the next. After the play is completed, ,students have a chance to converse with the characters about their actions during the play. “The Gioconda Smile’ is designed for all ESL students. We want to encourage them to talk about the ideas that they see in each scene, and show them that they can enjoy a play in English and understand it. The schedule is Monday, Oct. 26 through Thursday, Nov. 5 with day and evening performances. Tickets are $15.00. All performances are at Clarion Theatre, 309 East 26th Street, NYC. To make reservations or for further information please call me at 646-733-7685 or email at bbregstein@etnyarts.org.
results.name: ETNY Theatre for English Language Learners

results.description:
Maplewood Rotary is part of a global organization that has over a million members who are dedicated to making the world a better place. Our differing occupations, cultures, and countries give us a unique perspective. Our shared passion for service helps us accomplish the remarkable. Our local club meets Tuesdays at 6:30PM at the Toro Loco Restaurant in South Orange, NJ. We are a diverse and active club that works in the local area to support activities primarily focused on children and children’s health. As one of our members is fond of saying “We raise lots of money and give it all away.” We have a great time doing just that. We invite you to dinner. Come visit a meeting, meet our club members and learn how you can join us to help with local projects are well as projects around the world. WHAT MAKES US DIFFERENT? Our distinct point of view and approach gives us unique advantages: • We see differently: Our multidisciplinary perspective helps us see challenges in unique ways. • We think differently: We apply leadership and expertise to social issues—and find unique solutions. • We act responsibly: Our passion and perseverance create lasting change. • We make a difference at home and around the world: Our members can be found in your community and across the globe. 

HOW DO WE WORK? Our impact starts with our members—people who work tirelessly with their clubs to solve some of our communities' toughest challenges. Their efforts are supported by Rotary International, our member association, and The Rotary Foundation, which turns generous donations into grants that fund the work of our members and partners around the world. Rotary is led by our members—responsible leaders who help to carry forward our organization's mission and values in their elected roles. 

HOW DID WE GET HERE? We've been making history and bringing our world closer together for over 100 years. Since forming in 1905, we've taken on some of the world's toughest challenges and helped a wide range of international and service organizations—from the UN to Easter Seals—get started. 

HOW DO WE USE OUR FUNDS? Responsible leadership means more than just doing good work—it means making the most out of every donation we receive. 

WHAT CAUSES DO WE SUPPORT? We have identified specific causes to target to maximize our local and global impact. At the same time, we understand that each community has its own unique needs and concerns. Through our network of resources and partners, we help clubs focus their service efforts in promoting peace, fighting disease, providing clean water, saving mothers and children, supporting education, and growing local economies.
results.name: Maplewood Rotary

results.description:
Greetings,

Thank you for your interest in the Young Black Women of a Certain Sophistication Club (11). 

This group caters to a small and select number of professional, educated, ambitious and sophisticated African American women between the age of 28-45 who are looking to meet other well-rounded women for solid friendships, thought provoking discussions, meetings, activities, travel and social gatherings.

Our aim is to provide an intimate network for women who enjoy a variety of activities including, but not limited to:

• Wine and dinner

• Intellectual conversations

• Travel & Spa Getaways

• Live music

• Parenting talks

• Community service

• and much more

If you're looking for a group where you can unwind, get to know wonderful ladies and build a support network, this might be the group for you.

Our events only take place once a month so please watch out for our invitations and communications and indicate your attendance. All members are expected to reply to the RSVP.

Thank you for your interest in our Club (11).

Things to consider before joining:

1.  If accepted, you will receive an email and/or message with temporary acceptance into the group, and further instruction.  Without response, in three days, you will be removed. 

2. Please note that many of our events will take place in Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, and North NJ. Having access to a car may be helpful.

3. This group will only accept a small and select group of women. 

4. There is an annual $20.00 membership fee that must be paid on your anniverasy date,.

Warm regard,

Jinelle C.

All religious women, single, separated, divorced, never married -married and lost or lonely- with kids or without) are welcome to join us on our journey to explore what it really means to live our beliefs every day and practice our faith beyond Sunday mass. results.description:
TheConnectionMovement is committed to reviving human connection with ourselves and each other.  We are a growing community of over 100 regularly active participants and 1000+ members of the greater community that share a commitment to deeper connection and richer communication in our lives.

An oasis and playground for connection, TheConnectionMovement meets 6-10 times per month in New York City.  Our get-togethers include social experiments, social gatherings, a deep and powerful inter-relational meditation practice called "Circling", and "Connection Labs" (structured activities that flex and engage our empathy, playfulness, listening, self-expression, and vulnerabilty).  The foundational principles and tools we engage with are inspired by the teachings of NonViolent Communication, Circling Europe, The Circling Institute, Authentic World, Ken Wilber's Integral Practices, and Creative Drama.

Founded in 2012 by Dan Sieling and Amy Silverman under the original name "Authentic Relating NY", TheConnectionMovement is directed and facilitated by Amy Silverman.  www.AmySilverman.com
results.name: The Connection Movement

results.description:
Calling all women seriously looking to lose weight, get fit, eat and live a healthy lifestyle. This is primarily a support group to gather like minded women who want to live a healthy lifestyle but need some positive peer pressure, motivation and friends to share the journey with. We can share books, ideas, recipes, techniques on holistic health/fitness/beauty topics. We can attend events, classes, cook and workout together. This group is intended to be a circle of friends working toward a common goal together, not just a group having events. 


***This group is not for the holistic beauty expert ( although we would still love to connect with you)**** 

This group is for the holistic health newbie that has bought a few books, followed a few experts on youtube or instagram, attended a yoga class or meditation class, joined the gym and started eating kale ...... but is still carrying around those extra lbs, eating what we know is bad for us and allowing stress to get the best of us. If you are looking for a group of women focused on healing the mind body spirit and looking Fabulous in the process then join the group and lets discuss over a cup of jasmine tea ;-)

results.description:
Every year during the Awards season, if you are a voter for Oscars, SAG Award, WGA/PGA/DGA/BAFTA Award, etc, you probably would be bombarded with free screening invites. (Many of them even include Q&A with stars/director/writers. Such screenings will be featured on this site) And I can't be the only one who thought it would be fun to go there with multiple people, getting together after the movie and talk about what we just saw. (And maybe, you might meet someone new...) If that's what you have in mind, this meetup is for you.

Wouldn't it be nice to be able to see movies possibly with the likes of Daniel Day-Lewis, Sally Field, Matt Damon, Matthew McConaughey, Jessica Chastain, Steven Spielberg, Bill Murray, George Clooney, Kiera Knightly, Scarlett Johansson, Anne Hathaway, Robert DeNiro, Hillary Swank, Felicity Jones, etc and ask them questions directly in person afterwards? For all this for free? Or see all these Oscar contender films before everyone else has a chance to see them at all at some gorgeous and cushy private screening rooms (with no worries for bedbugs)? This is a privilege we have as voters (who are truly in this show business and really work there, not as a spectator) and that's the experience we will be able to share once you join this group, ultimately will lead us into our exclusive Oscars Viewing Party.

(I wish I could make the site more visible for non-members so that people can actually see what kind of movies we are offering. Unfortunately, the team of studio attorneys warned us that we are being watched - for understandable reason since we deal with many yet-to-be-released films and Q&A events with high profile celebrities - so I'll have to make it private until you join us once the award season gets underway. Sorry about that.)

Voters are entitled to one guest (note: guests do NOT need to be guild members) so the numbers can grow pretty quickly. However, in terms of joining this group, we need to limit to people in the 20s - 50s who are members of any of the following (required to be able to actually sign up for the screenings for free - Studios do check the membership card so please be honest. Otherwise, we wouldn't be able to help you): AMPAS, HFPA, BAFTA, SAG-AFTRA, DGA, PGA, WGA and others. (If you do not know the meaning of ANY of these abbreviations, then most likely, you cannot join this group. Sorry... UNLESS you have a referral from an existing member or you have a close friend who is a voting member who can help you get in)
results.name: NY Exclusive Academy/Guild Voter Screening Meetup 2015-2016

results.description:
Ever had a great idea? Well, of course you have. You're human. Have you ever had the motivation and resources to see that idea executed to completion? Well, that's a much better question. It is uncommon for one person to have all the resources and skill to execute a great idea.

Welcome to TeamLab. This is where people from varying backgrounds come together to achieve something great. We pool our brainpower, willpower, skill and everything else to reach that goal. Goals can range from building an amplifier for music production to developing a new startup idea. If you are an electrician, a musician, an entrepreneur, a biologist, or even just someone with a bunch of great ideas, then join this group. I look forward to learning something from everyone who joins. Let's build something great.
results.name: TeamLab-Idea Execution Hub

results.description:
Why study the Enneagram?

Studying the Enneagram deeply is a spiritual approach to understanding each personality type as a hidden gift.  It can be a tool to help us become more “mindful” and teach us how to become more compassionate, forgiving, and accepting of others by first gaining a deeper, more compassionate understanding our own personality.

The modern day Enneagram (Greek for “9-diagram”) has been presented by many as a simple study of Personality Types for some forty years now. Indeed people around the world have used it as a tool similar to the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator as a way to better understand ourselves and improve our corporate success as well as our personal relationships. While this is certainly true there is so much more to gain from engaging the Enneagram on a deeper level.

Please join us! Even if you are new to this topic you are most welcome! Our mission is to listen and learn from one another in a safe and supportive setting. Ultimately we hope to discern how best to use this system to not only better our own lives but also the lives of everyone we touch.
results.name: Upper West Side Enneagram Meetup

results.description:

These concerts take place at the Zimmerli and allow visitors to enjoy art and music side-by-side. Each concert is preceded by a master class or workshop related to the performance theme. Pre-concert forums and concerts are organized to present a broad repertoire accessible to audiences of all ages. 

This year starts off with Russian Masterpieces, a program solely devoted to music by Russian composers. The pre-concert forum will be presented by pianist Yevgeny Morozov and flautist Amy Tu, with performances by Yevgeny Morozov, Amy Tu, Anna Vasilyeva Shagun (piano), and Hyeri Choi (violin).

Music at the Museum performances are FREE to the general public, but seating is limited.

results.description: Save “The Date” A Dating Workshop- Finding True LOVE Online or Offline Are you more likely to find ‘The One’ online or offline? Is social media bringing you closer together as a couple or tearing you apart? What impact is technology having on your relationship? The Save “The Date” workshop explores all of the above and more. Please come with an open heart and an open mind. Finally connect to the truth about the success of online dating, texting, social media and LOVE. Mikka Onita, the founder of Club Millennial, LLC will host a guided discussion where you will have the opportunity to share stories and compare your experiences with newfound data. Couples therapist, Jan Summers will explain the psychological impact technology can have on loving, committed relationships. According to statistics, 40 million Americans are online daters. How does your personal life compare? Are you more connected in your relationship due to texting, email and social media or could you turn on your love life by turning off your phone? Come prepared to download the truth. Exclusive registration. Limited availability. Register today.
results.name: A Dating Workshop-Finding True Love Online or Offline

results.description:
What is Satsang?

Satsang is the Sanskrit word essentially meaning coming together in Truth. "Sat" means Truth or True and "Sang(ha)" means community. Satsang is coming together in honor of Truth, this universal divinity that is Here at all times no matter what seems to be on the surface.


What is Satsang with Tathina?

Satsang with Tathina (tah-tee-nuh) meetings are open to anyone who wants to explore the Truth of themselves. Your questions and reports lead us into a deep inquiry of what is true beyond the stories we tell ourselves. Satsang with Tathina meetings welcome every aspect of this human experience as sacred invitations to Self discovery.

Satsang is not the space to attain knowledge or accrue more concepts, Satsang is the space where you let go of everything. In doing this, the true attainment can happen. This is a retreat from the narratives one gives attention to on a daily basis to discover the Freedom that is always Here. This silent space is where there is no seeker, no teacher, no student, just THIS celebration. Join us if this resonates and you feel called to come. :)


Meet Tathina:

Tathina (tah-tee-nuh) is originally from Southern New Jersey and started searching for true fulfillment senior year in college when she took Eastern religion classes alongside her psychology major classes in 2009. After graduating from college she had an unstoppable urge to search for Truth. She searched through many paths and teachers, but nothing quenched this thirst.

During this period she was retreating from the world much more and she was brought to her teacher/guru Samarpan of Germany via the internet when she realized she needed guidance beyond her mind. He gave her the name Tathina meaning "unlimited" in 2013 and she went from Jennifer to Tathina. He pointed her to Truth, to this space where there was no seeker. She discovered there was no seeker, no one separate from THAT, Life, Peace, and never had been and this discovery becomes more obvious when one is in peace with being totally human. This is when the divinity of Existence can be seen in this moment.

She shares this invitation, wherever invited, with people who come to her in Satsang. She is the author of The Invitation (to Live) (the Truth) and shares free articles and fun meditation challenges and much more on her website tathina.com and blog theinvitationtolivethetruth.wordpress.



                                                                           ~* Namaste' * ~
results.name: Satsang with Tathina

results.description:
Do you see yourself as a "thinker for world change?" A thought leader?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lvHLCbcSSdg

Join a no-cost event that will give you a taste of this visionary networking experience! http://inspiredleadersacademy.com/inspired/lid-kickoff-b/ 

 Maybe you work in an organization and have a burning concept you want to bring to market. 

Maybe you're an academic, eager to get on a TED stage; or a doctor, psychologist, coach or other expert wanting to showcase your expertise. 

Maybe you're already an entrepreneur--business or social--and have a new idea that could impact even greater change. 

I'm Lizabeth Phelps, founder of Inspired Leaders' Academy, and the entrepreneurs I work with are spurred every day by pretty big missions; the networking opportunities available to them leave them (and me) feeling empty. 

So, I've created a "new class" of networking experience that emphasizes *peer-to-peer* knowledge, cutting-edge discussion, future visioning, thought leadership and collaboration. 

It is based on the discussion-type gatherings attended by the great philosophers and inventors of Europe's Age of Enlightenment, who succeeded in large part because of the discussion groups they attended.

 Become a dues-based member and you become part of an "alliance"--a brother/sisterhood, really--where your business connections are made from deep interaction.

results.description:
Real Estate investing can be overwhelming especially if you are just starting out. Why go at it alone? 

There are too many courses to buy, guru's to follow, coaching, mentoring programs that many beginners get information overload and never take action. Having the right knowledge is key and there is no better teacher than experience don't lose money trying to figure it all out on your own. 

There are 4 things Each Invest Must Do: 

1. Find Cheap Houses 

2. Analyze Deals 

3. Make Offers 

4. Find Buyers 

This is a group for anyone interested in real estate investing as a team sport. We find ,analyze, make offers and market profitable real estate deals as a team. We specialize in co-wholesaling and join venture fix and flip deals. Wholesaling is the easiest way to get started in real estate because you don't need any of your own money or credit. 

But beginners are faced with a chicken or egg problem. They don't have a Buyer's List and they are afraid to get a property under contract because they may not be able to sell it before the closing date. 

With Co-wholesaling you don't have to have both a buyer's list and a property under contract you can market a property that another group member already has under contract. Why would you want to do that? You get a chance to build a buyer's list by marketing a real property if you find a buyer you get paid a % of the wholesaler's fee if not you are still building a buyer's list from all the buyers that contacted you. If you are great at finding deals then you get a bunch of free marketing to sell more properties faster. 


Joint Venture Fix and Flip deals are a way to leverage your capital For example: a group of 5 people with $20K each can find, analyze, offer, fix and market a deal they bought for $50K +50K rehab and sell for $200K each profiting $20K + their original investment. 

The purpose of this group is to provide a structured format for team real estate investing by combining learning with hands on action taking. 

Let's do some deals together!
results.name: Co-Wholesaling & Joint Venture Real Estate Meetup

results.description:
We dream of a world in which each individual is fully aware and engaged in a life of shared learning and discovery. This conversation series will create a collaborative, positive, diverse learning community to share learnings, perspectives, insights, reflection, wisdom and casual observations between members around a variety of topics of interest to the members.

L2O is a new social network designed to inspire us all to experience life through the lens of a learning mindset. We believe engaged, deliberate recording of everyday learnings and sharing these with others we can trust will help us all to adopt the learning mindset across various aspects of our personal and professional lives. Our conversation series will include group sessions of shared learning as well as other inspirational learners who will catalyze our discussions.

We are looking for members who are interested in a lifetime of continued learning. Our meetups will include learners from all walks of life, and the discussion will revolve around their ideas for how to remain curious and open-minded in today's world. Consistent with our goal, we will initiate and follow each conversation with group discussion in smaller and larger groups.  We will include learners from the worlds of science, art, religion, philosophy, education, environment, food, health, politics, etc. - anyone who is passionate about the world, about constantly learning and reflecting, and can offer a unique perspective.  If these discussions sound like something you would learn from and contribute to, we hope you'll join us.

Members will receive invites to our discussions and talks and will be among the first to know when we have product updates or new launches. Our events will be a place to reflect, discuss some things with others who share a curious mindset, and walk away with your brain feeling refreshed!  Right now most of our events will be in NYC (mostly Manhattan), but in the coming months we will be expanding - to request a speaker or topic, please reach out to Feedback@l2o.com!
results.name: L2O Conversations:  Shared Learning & Discovery

results.description: ACTIVIST ART has long been critiqued for its didacticism. The metaphor is wittier than the straightforward, and the protest's form is purposeless because it detracts from intent. But what if the opposite were true? Rather than using art as a language to fuel political rhetoric, what if political rhetoric were used to fuel art? Are ornamental activism, ethical imagining and speculative poetics more useful means of creating dialogue than the current fad of antagonism as form? This group is interested in derailing Donald Trump. If you hate him, or are interested in some of the ideas above (or BOTH) -- please consider joining! We are looking for cultural producers, artists, academics, activists, dancers, body-movers, politicians, lawyers and just about anyone else. The storm is called progress and we are trying to make it.
results.name: Ethical Imagining // F**k Donald Trump

results.description:
***Every Day's an Adventure! Live Life Outside Your Box***

What does it mean? We live inside our own personal boxes without realizing that there is a whole other world out there for us to see.

What does it really mean to live your life outside your box? There’s not an actual box.

“Live Life Outside Your Box” is the way you choose to live your life. The sum total of your life experiences.  Everyone’s is different and the more times you step outside it, the bigger your box gets.

There’s just one little problem. Your life inside your box is where you are the most comfortable. It’s safe.

You ask “why should I live outside my box?” Well, there are many reasons. First, and most important, it helps you GROW as a person. You will see the world in a different way. You will learn new things, meet new people and become more of the person you’re supposed to be. When you grow, you have more to offer others and you get back more from them. In short, you will live a more successful life.

You ask “How does one live life outside the box?” It will take a lot of courage but you CAN DO IT! Start small and get bigger. Try something new… maybe try a new cuisine you’ve never tried before. Try to do something that you wouldn’t normally do. For example, learn indoor rock climbing. Take a cooking class. Do something that’s not already in your box. You have to do something NEW. Something different. Something that you have never done before.

As you get comfortable with small steps, take bigger steps. Skydive. Speak in front of a group of people. Perform in a play. It doesn’t matter what you do as long as you step outside of your comfort zone to do it and you keep growing your comfort zone.

Eventually, you will be able to take a giant leap. Is there something in your life that you’ve wanted to do, but have been afraid to do it? Face up to it and do it. This is when you begin to direct your steps so that you can get the life you want.

As you grow and your box grows, you will begin to focus your steps in a positive way. It becomes easier.  Every time you take a step, your vision expands, you grow as a person. Your box gets a little bigger. You move to a higher purpose just as you were meant to do.

One of our greatest sources of authentic power in life comes from our willingness and ability to act – especially in the face of obstacles and fear.

To be truly successful and fulfilled, we must challenge ourselves to take bold and courageous actions and to go for and do what we want.

IMPORTANT GROUP RULES: A successful group is not about how many members there are in the group. It is about the quality of members in the group! We would rather have a small group of "quality members" than a huge group of "joiners" and “lurkers” who never show up to any event.

With that said, please note: 

(1) To join the group, you must have a recognizable face picture; and

(2) Being a member in the group, you don’t have to attend every event on the calendar, but try to participate in at least 1 event every few months. If you are a general lurker who join the group but not participate in any event, please don’t bother to join.

MEETUP FEE:  To help defray the cost of paying Meetup HQ to keep the site up and running, a $1.00 Meetup fee will be collected at randomly selected events.

General rsvp policy:

Yes rsvps ONLY if you are serious about attending an event. No need to rsvp if not attending.

We will enforce a strict ANTI-FLAKE POLICY - Just one (1) no-show or last minute (less than 24 hours) cancel will get you booted out of the group.

If you are an RSVP-aholic, that is, you rsvp to every single event and then bail out last minute, you don't belong in this group and are NOT welcome.
results.name: Live Life Outside the Box

We are focusing on cloud mobile computing using Java, mobile and responsive web technologies. Covered technologies include cloud computing, application servers, Java, JSF, JPA, responsive web technologies, mobile technologies, jQuery, jQuery Mobile, HTML5, CSS, etc. 

We will talk about cloud mobile computing infrastructure that will help enterprises develop and deploy E-commerce(B2B, B2C, C2C, O2O) platforms, Internet+, and multitenant cloud-enabled application modules. 

We will talk about a new responsive web technology (CMobileCom WAF) that will help developers to build responsive web applications using Java API without writing any tag pages. Web applications based on the technology will be automatically responsive to all desktop and mobile devices with mobile touch optimized. It can be configured as a multitenant cloud computing infrastructure.

We are gathering to learn from each other and from experts on the newest technologies in these areas, which will help us professionally, help our current and new projects. In the meantime we will make meaningful connections and friends.
results.name: Cloud Mobile Computing and Responsive Web Technology

results.description: This group is for like-minded men who are looking to make physical and mental improvements to their life but they are having a hard time doing it alone. Research show's that being a part of a community that shared your goals is integral to achieving them. Personally, I've always participated in team sports or activities like football, wrestling, rugby, and martial arts. What keeps me coming back and engaged is the community and camaraderie inherent in these group activities. Weightlifting is another matter though. I know my way around a gym, but lifting alone is difficult for me. The lack of accountability and engagement usually leads me to modifying routines that shouldn't be modified or abandoning lifting all together and focussing on my group activities (Currently Brazilian Jiu Jitsu). So my goal for this group is to find some more buddies who want to partner with me on lifting. I'm going to be on the program outlined in "Man 2.0, Engineering the Alpha." This group is for guys like me, to find other guys like me, so that we can do this together! While I have a specific program that I want to engage, this group will serve as a hub for other guys in our situation to meet one another, find someone else who wants to engage in a program of your choosing and move onward!

results.description:
Do you have too much "month" at the end of the money? Or too much "money" at the end of the month? Chances are you have too much month! Working a job with a bunch of people you don't like is already a struggle but living paycheck to paycheck is just as stressful. If you truly want to make more money and enjoy more of your life there is only two ways to do it legally, win the lotto or personal development! I chose personal development! 

I have studied this industry for over a decade and was privileged to meet some very rich and wealthy people. Over the years I have only practiced strategies used by the wealthy and it has transformed my life from not being able to afford most things to now-being able to live a life free of financial boundaries. As a result I wanted to share what I've learned from self-improvement and the only way I could do that was to create a new word, "Selfceed". Selfceed means to succeed in self, building a sound character that runs on a core philosophy of, you are what you attract by the person you become.  The Selfceed Forum is essentially a book club forum designed to help members make more money, manage their time and problems better by interacting with like-minded individuals who practice self-improvement. Our only requirement is that when you join us, you come with an open mind and a coachable outlook. 

Napoleon Hill invested decades into exploring what millionaires and billionaires in America had in common. He discovered that a key factor in their practices included "A Mastermind Group" which involved getting around like-minded individuals brainstorming on how to get ahead and The Selfceed Forum can be your mastermind group! I have invested over a decade into this field and I would like for you all to help evolve this concept to be more mainstream by empowering others who really need a hand up, not a hand out. Please continue to check back for our meetup dates and locations.
results.name: The Selfceed Forum of Middlesex County

topics.name: Aikido Self Defense Classes - Private & Group

results.description:
Aikido is a unique martial art, the full power of which is rarely seen. From a self-defense aspect it can end an attack suddenly, severely and decisively or dissipate it with the gentleness of a soft breeze.


Aikido's unique approach is to blend with an attack rather than clash with it. The attack is redirected safely away into a throw or pin. Its circular, flowing techniques are effective and can be learned by anyone regardless of size, age or gender. Men, women, children and seniors all find it appealing because Aikido techniques are not based on pitting one's strength against another's. Students learn to defend themselves without resorting to aggressive or violent behavior. Self esteem, concentration, awareness and focusing power are enhanced. Balance and calmness are therefore maintained in all situations. This state of being is then carried off the mat and into the activity and interactions of daily life.

Aikido Centers was established in 1988 after Sensei O'Connor had been studying and teaching for 12 years. At Aikido Centers we teach traditional Aikido as handed down by Aikido's founder, Morihei Ueshiba.

Aikido Centers is the largest traditional Aikido dojo organization in New Jersey. We currently have traditional Aikido dojos in East Hanover, Sparta, Paterson, Manasquan, Summit (at the Summit YMCA), River Edge, Montclair, Marlboro and in Lancaster, PA
results.name: Introduction to Aikido

Our Goals:

1. Create a strong member network for local innovators, and stakeholders, equip them with the resources they need to prosper, create jobs, and function in harmony with local ecosystems. 

2. CREATE A BUY LOCAL PRECEDENCE - Keep Dollars in the Local Economy/Reduce Capital Leakage – for every $100 spent at a locally-owned business, $73 remains in the local economy, compared to that of a non-locally owned business which only retains $43. We know that entrepreneurship fuels economic innovation and prosperity, and serves as a key means for families to move out of low wage jobs and into the middle class.

results.description:
This group has been created for the benefit of the real state community in New York City. 

Landlords, Owners, Real Estate Managers, Real Estate Brokers, Engineers, Architects, Mechanical Contractors, Plumbers, PLC Programmers, Electrical Contractors, and other professionals who identify themselves with this group description; all these profiles are very welcome to meet this group. 

The promoters of this group have extensive experience in designing and implementing control systems to provide energy-efficiency, savings, safety and comfort in both residential and commercial buildings. 

New York City has around 1 million buildings considering residential and commercial buildings together, and many of them have substandard heating systems. 

Some of the scenarios that can be found in old buildings are: 

• Heating rooms without any digital control. 

• Heating rooms with some kind of digital control but with no control inside the apartments. 

• Digital systems integrated in the facility but not working or doing what it is supposed to do, or how the property would like.  

• Facilities with or without digital control not offering the necessary data to know how is working the building in terms of energy-efficiency. 

• During the winter time, tenants receiving too much heat in their apartments and having to open the windows to lower the temperature, while others complaint because they do not receive enough heating in their apartments. 

• Boilers experimenting heating interruptions and supers/managers/owners receiving complaints for bad service or no heating water in the apartments. 

• Oil tanks becoming empty without any previous notice or alarm. 

• Facilities with several control panels installed without any efficient-efficiency criteria. 

• Buildings with high consumption spending. 

• Equipment with very low or without acceptable safety standards. 

For all the scenarios mentioned above, but for many others there are excellent, affordable, and reliable solutions. 

This group pretends to facilitate the communication in between professionals related to the real estate industry, to exchange professional experiences, share valuable knowledge, exchange business cards, but also to generate business opportunities for all of them. 

We hope this is considered as a good networking opportunity to have real business chances for the benefit of the entire community.
results.name: Energy Efficiency and Safety for Buildings in NYC

results.description:
Brooklyn Creative Safe-Spaces is a meetup group dedicated to creativity oriented "non-support groups" for individuals with past or present experience of mental health issues or extreme states. (The term "extreme states” is used here to recognize alternative modes of awareness that are not necessarily understood as health problems by those experiencing them.)  All of the events in this group are hosted by PROPELLER, a New York City wellness initiative that aims to promote mental and emotional well-being through advocacy and community building.

PROPELLER rejects the problem/problem-solving focus of traditional support groups, attempting instead to cultivate wellness by fostering positive forces such as community, connection, creativity, and fun. In our Creative Safe-Spaces, this is done through the offering of (what we at least hope to be) interesting and engaging creative/collaborative activities such as “Exquisite Corpse" (surrealist drawing game), non-graffiti street art, audio collage + noise jam, Dada poetry, original origami, and natural structure/sculpture building. 

To be clear, we are all for people talking about their experiences with mental health issues/extreme states in our groups. It is just that in these spaces we focus on creating the SAFETY to talk, rather than any sort of PRESSURE or EXPECTATION to. It is also worth noting that while there is a focus on creativity and creative collaboration at our events, there is no need for anyone who comes to be artistically skilled, and everything is 100% laid back in terms of whether you want to participate in activities, make things on your own, or just hang out!

If you are interested in learning more about PROPELLER and its larger mission and offerings, you can check out the mother-meetup here. Note that if you become a member of that meetup you will start receiving updates about new Brooklyn Creative Safe-Spaces, so there is no need to be a member of both this meetup and the mother-meetup.

Hope to see you at a Brooklyn Creative Safe-Space soon!

-Josh K.
results.name: Brooklyn Creative Safe-Spaces (MH Issues & Extreme States)

Calling all Super Smash Bros players! Beginners, Amateurs & pros.  Do you have the skills to be the best? Do you want to win cash prizes, gift certificates and champion recognition for being the best?
Then this meetup group is for you.

Super smash bros tournaments (for WII U) around New York City, but mostly in Williamsburg Brooklyn. There will be two types of Tournaments. Standard Tournament and the Royal battle tournament. 

Beginners, Amateurs and Pros are welcomed to practice on non-tournament days (Sun 1pm-6pm, Mon 6pm-1am, Sat 10pm-2am).

1. Standard Tournament - One on one battles, best two out of three per round played on two 55" big screen televisions. Winners will advance to the next round, until the final championship battle. First prize winners will win $50-$75 in cash or gift certificates. Second and Third place will win gift certificates.

2. Ultimate Action Tournament - (Designed by Action Burger) 5-10 rounds, eight players per tv (two televisions, A & B). Every round, the last place person will be eliminated. Matches will count down to final 1st round, where three final players will battle it out for first, second and third place. The battle continues, 6 final players from televisions A & B, will play against each other in teams, 3 vs 3, in a best of 2 out of 3 final battle. The team that wins will win the tournament. The 1st, 2nd & 3rd place winners will win their prizes in their original previous game order. So, what are you waiting for? Sign up!  Have a question, ask the group.

**Don't RSVP if you aren't 100% sure you can make it that day for the Tournament.  You must give 24 hour notice if you plan to cancel, so standby RSVPs can enter the contest.  RSVP's on standby must be ready to goto tournament if they move into an open slot.  Please be considerate of other members who really want to compete.  Practice days doesn't matter. 

Take a 360 video tour of Action Burger:


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o3CtbO6_nwA

results.description: The Latosa Escrima System The philosophy behind the Latosa Escrima system is very simple; the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. For example, a technique does not work by itself unless combined with the concepts of balance, power, speed, focus, timing, and attitude. When combining these elements, the outcome or whole is far more effective then what would normally be the sum of the parts. This is the reason techniques, as practiced in the system, are only tools used to understand, accept and retain these ideas. The number of different techniques mastered by an individual does not increase his level of competence in this system. Techniques are only practiced moves until combined with the proper fighting concepts. The ultimate goal of the martial arts is to make your mental, physical and technical skills work as one. The goal of Latosa Escrima is to do this while producing a quality Escrimador who can think creatively and react responsively rather than giving people information overload. Escrima was the original name used under the flag of the Philippine Martial Arts Society. The name changed to Combat Escrima as the system was influenced by the concept of using power and combat reality. Combat Escrima relied on a single goal; winning. This goal proved to be a very valuable asset. The intimidation factor of the name "Combat Escrima" was something the students felt they had to defend. However, just the goal of winning actually proved limiting in the progression of the system and future instructors. PMAS produced excellent fighters and world champions but failed to produce very many well-rounded instructors. PMAS had the box recipe for producing competent fighters but failed to isolate the individual ingredients that make up the end product. Latosa spent his time developing training methods used to understand the reasoning behind the techniques and isolating the concepts of Escrima. Wing Tzun is self defense in it's most consequent form Wing Tzun is the smartest self-defense system ever thought of by humankind, because Wing Tzun is not based upon physical strength or acrobatic ability and therefore allows a physically weaker person to defend him/herself. Wing Tzun teaches you to use the force of the opponent and turn it against him. Wing Tzun self defense movements derive from tactile reflexes that are mechanical and directly determined by the attack of the opponent. In this way WT is not susceptible to optical manipulations meant to mislead the fighter. Wing Tzun can be learned fairly quickly and built upon. Wing Tzun meets the demands of "appropriate force" and therefore lends itself for use by law enforcement.
results.name: Latosa Escrima and Wing Tsun Meetup
